text: Techno-clubby music (loud too), smoke from the casino, and high prices are jarring notes to this otherwise decent restaurant in Bally's casino. I've had the red curry and the pho ga. Both were good, the curry having a good amount of heat as requested, but the 18$ for each entree was on the high side of what it should have been.  The pho ga broth seeemed overly salty and oily.  If you have to eat here, its OK, but if you have a car, go visit a real Thai place.

The best Thai restaurant in Vegas! It can be a little tricky to find (it's somewhat hidden in the Bally's hotel/casino), but the food is phenomenal.

Me and my girlfriend like to split and appetizer (or two) and an entree, and it is the perfect amount of food! 

We can't wait until we're back in Vegas because this is one of our go-to restaurants!

I actually thought this was really good! I had the basil chicken. Yum! My husband didn't think his pad Thai was hot enough, even though he asked for five in spice level. He ended up asking for Thai peppers. He was happy then. He is used to thai hot so....

I liked this place just fine, but I think the decor and ambiance out shown the food in my opinion. There were a lot of fantastic items on the menu - in fact so many it was hard to choose! I had heard that the spicy soba noodles were a hit, so I went with that. It was good, but not great. Although there was plenty of shrimp on it, they were all butterflied, and nothing was over cooked. I suppose it was just that explosion of flavor that I love from Thai food that was missing. 

Combine that with the Strip prices - I spent $40 on an entree and sake, and I left feeling like it was an ok experience for the price.

This was our first visit to Las Vegas and we found the SEA Thai Restaurant pretty much by accident in a corner of the Bally's Resort & Casino as we were exploring the area prior to lunchtime. With its rectangular pond with unique wooden tables integrated around it - overlooked by a statue of Buddha - we thought that we'd give it a try for dinner. So we requested a table by the pool for dinner. 

When we arrived that evening we were happy to find that our requested table was actually waiting for us. (This definitely does not happen in a lot of restaurants when a specific table or area is requested.)   We started with the coconut spring rolls, which were crispy and delicious (four to an order). My wife had the Queen of Siam Basil Chicken and I had the Bangkok Panang Curry with shrimp as a main course. Both were excellent and seasoned to our desired level of hotness.

The wait staff was friendly and efficient. As noted by other reviews, the prices are a bit higher than what is normaly expected for Thai/Vietnamese food, but as one quickly learns in Las Vegas, nothing is cheap on The Strip. And compared to other restaurants that we visited on this trip, the prices were actually moderate.

SEA is a restaurant definitely worth visiting. It's small, so I'd recommend making a reservation - and requesting a table by the pool.

We come here every time we are in Las Vegas. It is somewhat hidden in the back of Bally's casino but it's a gem. The Thai iced coffee is the best I've ever had (you can even get it for dessert as a float!). Other must-haves are the Caesar salad and the drunken noodles.

Tasty food, but unless you have s death wish, don't order anything spicy over level 3 on their scale of 1-5! I enjoy spicy food, but the level 4 Island Red Curry was a bit too much to really "enjoy". Also, due to the large, unheated plates, the sauce was pretty cool. They need to warm the plates before serving. The  chicken and shrimp dumpling appetizer was delicious. Beware... The Tamarind Bass is a complete fish, so is best if split between a group of diners.

Food was delicious. A little pricey for the portions but it was high quality and very good flavor. Seems to be a little hidden so it wasnt too busy, in a good way. I'd come back again for sure but not a place I would eat often.

I've visited the original Sea in Brooklyn, NY so while in Vegas I had to stop in to check out the new location inside Ballys. We purchased a Groupon for 2 apps and 2 entrees and it was well worth it. 

We had coconut shrimp and the chicken/shrimp fried dumplings for apps. Both were very tasty though the coconut shrimp had a little too much breading and was fried a little too hard. But enjoyable nonetheless.

My husband's sizzling mixed seafood combo was very good although couldve used a sauce to compliment the dish. My short ribs and mixed greens salad was great! I received 4 huge pieces of ribs and a nice sauce to dip on the side. They were seasoned really well and very juicy.

Classic bbq pork chop was good.  I try pork all over Las vegas and this was good juicy pork with sweet flavors.  They were able to make my Negroni cocktail without me telling them how which was nice, however they left out the orange peel.  I tried some of the dish off of other plates on the table and the calamari was pretty tough. Good atmosphere and service.
The environment is awesome! And the soup is the best I ever tried in Thai restaurant. Pretty special experience in LV
First time ever having Thai food and I'm now in love. Spice was spot on, service was phenomaneal, you cannot go wrong here.

Was a little hesitant to come here from reading the reviews...but my experience was total opposite from what was written!! The staff was very friendly, and gave great service. I had the Black Noodles (Pad See Eiw) with beef, and my fianc√© had the Pad Thai. Both were amazing, and we didn't have to wait long for the food. We had the Golden Fried Banana with Mango Ice Cream, which was also delicious. The price was on the higher end for Thai food, which is why I won't give the full 5 stars.
Love the ambience. I ordered the papaya salad and rib eye salad and both were amazing. I look forward to eating here again.

This food was horrible and ridiculously expensive. This place is one of the only places on the strip open late and it is only for people who are drunk and don't give a damn. Just be smart and eat before 10pm. Otherwise you have to deal with the bottom feeders of restaurants like this one.

The pho wasn't great - I don't recommend ordering it.  It was like eating spaghetti....they didn't give me the right utensils! You also need to ask for sriracha. You shouldn't have to ask.  However, the spicy soba noodles were FANTASTIC!  Staff is nice but they all wear walkie talkies which completely ruins the ambience.
Great experience!  Friendly, well verse, professional staff. I had lemongrass chicken which was amazing.

We literally planned our evening around the time Sea Thai claimed it closes, which is at midnight. Arrived at 11:30 after racing from Planet Hollywood, only to discover it was already closed. State properly your hours.

I was craving thai food while staying at the Paris and found sea thai on yelp so decided to give it a try. The only star I gave is for the decor and ambiance.  It's really modern and upscale looking inside for a thai restaurant. The food was beyond terrible. We ordered papaya salad spring rolls red curry and seafood noodles. Papaya salad wAs decent spring rolls were nothing great the curry was basically a soup that tasted nothing like curry! The noodles we told them to take away and ordered the pad Thai even that they could not make right! After a few bites and being disgusted we asked for the tab and left. So if your into real Thai food don't bother coming here because you will only be greatly disappointed
Food came out 30 to 40 min later and the whole fish never came. Took forever to sit us as well even though no one was in line.  Pad tai taste worst than middle planet

SEA is simply lovely. The decor is beautiful, simple, and peaceful. Staff members are attentive and gracious.

Unfortunately, all of this can't make up for the disappointing food. My dinner companion had the pad thai. I had the jungle curry. Both were some of the most lackluster Thai food we have ever had. 

If you want to enjoy a peaceful place, SEA will do just fine. If you're looking for good food, I'd probably look elsewhere.

Took my family here for dinner too... (besides the nasty and expensive buffet).  This place was very expensive for the foods that they serve.  Not sure why people like this place.  I'm so tired of all these fake paid reviews.... You better off go out of the strip to China town or Asian plazas for some real asian foods and save a lot of money... =(  I hate yelp now...

We got there around 10:30 pm, and were promptly seated. Very cool ambiance, and some unique seating arrangements, but by the end of the meal, sitting on a hard wooden bench really hurt my butt. We each ordered 1 well drink (rum & coke, gin & tonic), and specified house liquor. We shared a soup appetizer, pork belly with baby bok choy, and phad thai. The food was all very good, but everything was expensive. The main dishes were $18 each, and we just about crapped our pants when we got the bill and saw our house-well drinks were $10 each. That is insane. If we ever go back, we've learned our lesson not to order alcoholic drinks. On the plus side, the servers were very good at keeping our water glasses topped off, which is good since we order everything at a spicy 5-star.
Wow.  Great ambiance, food and service.  I don't give 5 stars unless its truly deserved.

This restaurant is visually pleasing and has pretty good food. I have been here twice and have gotten pad Thai tofu both visits. I love it! It is a pretty neat setting if you have the option of sitting in the booths that are set flush with the small pond. The waitstaff is friendly enough, but my boyfriend was shrugged off when he pointed out that his glass was cracked and cut his lip.

We just let Sea and the experience was not a Thai experience. The food was over priced for a piece of salmon and veggies for $28 and then charge $5 for a small bowl of rice. Being half Korean I've never heard of being charged rice at any spot in my entire life! The appetizers were dry with no flavor. Not impressed. Would never eat there again. One star.

My girlfriend and me decided to have dinner at SEA and enjoy the Thai food. She ordered a sort of crunchy salad ( greens with fried seafood) and I ordered fried rice with pineapple.
The salad was so spicy that she was not able eat it (hot!, burning!). The pineapple in my fried rice was almost non existent.
Quiet environment and reasonable prices but we did not like the food.

Wow, I didn't even realize this restaurant was at Ballys since it is kinda tucked away in a corner!  Everything we ate was excellent.  The service was great and very fast, and the ambiance is cool with surprisingly comfy benches set around a pond.  My husband and I both agree that the have THE BEST crab rangoon of any we have tried; if you like crab rangoon do not miss these!  The prices are really reasonable considering it is on The Strip, in fact we got 2 appetizers, 2 entrees and dessert and our food was about the same cost as a different place we go to by our house.  We will be back!

Went there during new years eve weekend for lunch. They didn't have much wait time so my husband and i decided to try it even though it had only 3 stars. We were so delighted that we did. It was definitely one of the top 3 meals we had there in the 4 days we were there. We ordered their coconut spring rolls, garlic mixed vegetables with tofu and spicy thai herb fried rice. We also got the mango sticky rice for dessert. All dishes were delicious. The ambience was perfect for a sit down meal and a break from the sounds of the casinos and the strip. Would totally recommend it if you are craving thai/Asian and want veggie choices. The prices were comparable to other restaurants in casino resorts and on the strip.

Unseasoned and bland. Waste of money

I ordered the duck confetti and was looking for Thai spices and rich noddles. The duck was dry and no seasoning.

I seriously dont know why this restaurant got 3& a half stars.

Our thai experience with my family was great.the food was great the service was superb.and the place was so cozy and lovely.

we ordered crab fried rice, chicken satay, seafood tomyum white soup, garlic prawns which was my favorite...it was a huge prawn.very very fresh and yummy...it was very very good.
bbq ribs sweet and yummy. 

The cozy cute place was very nice and decors are so ellegantly simple.
I love this restaurant.

Ordered take out yesterday. Very tasty. Tried the ragoons, as they got great reviews and I was not disappointed. Also ordered the Bangkok Panang. Great flavor. Could have been spicier in my opinion. I ordered medium and it was barely mild. Great flavor, and crunchy vegetables. Had to order rice separately. Weird. Also asked for plates, but when I got to my room there weren't any in the bag so I had to comprise. This place is inside Ballys. I would eat there again. Kind of pricey, but it's Las Vegas.

I am giving 1star for the dish that my daughter ordered. I wish I would not have bought there Groupon deal. Bad service.. waitress were just wanting us to leave asap.. picking up the dishes before we could finish our food. This is the first restaurant I found in Thai food where you have to order steam rice with your curry dishes. Would not recommend.
The best Thai restaurant I have dined in.  Our table shared the Crab rangoon, spring rolls, calamari and pad thai.  Everything was perfect.

The food has been consistently good over the past few days, as we're staying at Bally's for a "working" trip. We choose to eat here because it's close. The reason for only 3 stars is because the service is slow and you're never sure who your server is. I let it slide on a busy day. Today it's not so busy and the service still is lacking

Sitting here as I write this as we leave tomorrow. I wish we had tried this place first as would have tried more things. The Sea is in Ballys in a beautiful setting. The food is fresh, delicious and unique. Very well priced and generous entrees of spicy seafood and noodles plus more. Love the sea food salad.  We tried the most wonderful chefs special called the Hawaiian seafood tart it looks a bit weird but it's like a Korean pancake covered with a tempura batter over generous varieties of seafood. I would just come for that with a wine or cocktails to relax.  This will only be featured  here for a limited time. The other chef special are geyser prawns. The most gigantic prawns you have ever seen in a pot with perfectly done silver noodles. Don't want to bore you but our stomachs are so happy.  Closed between 230-5. Bar is next to them.
Nothing to write home about! Poor service and the herb fried rice was just ok. Will not recommend this place. There may be other better options...

Sea is the hidden gem of the Paris/Bally's compound. The stand outs at this restaurant are the entrees, the ambiance, and the staff.

We have tried many different appetizers here and have not found a favorite yet. That being said, we have tried the drunken noodle entr√©e, the red curry, and the green curry. Each dish is absolutely delicious. The jasmine rice is the perfect amount of sticky and is always served in generous portions.

It is certainly not cheap, but it is essentially a fine dining Thai restaurant in Las Vegas, so that is to be expected. It's absolutely gorgeous inside and the hostess is the nicest person working in a Las Vegas restaurant.

Ask for Grace, you won't be disappointed.

My wife and I had dinner here before going to a show one night, and for sure, this was one of the best Thai restaurants that we visited in Vegas by far. Service was excellent, from start to finish, they really make you feel special. The food came out fast and my wife and I enjoyed the Panang Curry, which is one of my favorites, the Spicy Coconut soup and their version of the Calamari. We will definitely come back here every time we get a chance and we highly recommend this Restaurant to anyone who wants to spice up their evenings...

Hangover cure? Vietnamese Pho.. Was told that there was a restaurant in Caesars Palace. My feet weren't really in the mood to walk that far. So I started searching Yelp & landed across this review! Which was great because I was about to settle for Tacos. You get what you pay for! The service was amazing! The Pho Thai Chin, was pretty plain.. But all in all it was really good especially when you are craving for it! The deep fried meat & veggie spring rolls were more then just good! It was awesome!
Totally would recommend it!

The Island Red Curry is delicious. I had it with beef at the level 3 spice level. 

There is nice seating around the pool, but no seat backs. Ask for a regular table if you want to sit in a chair with a back.

The atmosphere is pleasant; it can be a little loud, but is much quieter and smells better than the casino.
Wir haben Online Reserviert hat geklappt Essen ist sehr gut aber Achtung bei einer Gruppe von 5 Personen gibt es 20% Aufschlag wir haben nachgefragt das ist halt so und steht auf der Karte!

Decent Thai food, albeit overpriced (but it's Vegas, to be expected). Was a bit disappointed that they asked how spicy I wanted my food and instead of cooking it in that spice level just gave me a side of the spicy sauce. Drunken noodles were good though.

Place is difficult to find. It's INSIDE of Bally's. Once you're inside Bally's just keep walking straight ahead towards the Casino and look for signs. 

When I went with my friend in October for Halloween weekend, we were depriving ourselves of real food all weekend so we decided to try this restaurant out. It's a bit pricey than what I'm used to for Asian cuisine. I enjoyed that they served Vietnamese and Thai! Score. The decor is beautiful as well. There's a small swing the size of a ball you can rock back and forth (I don't know if that is allowed).

In the middle of the room there is a buddha sculpture with a nice "japanese" like setting pond around it. REALLY great atmosphere. It was kind of romantic, especially when they dim the lights and the candles are lit. I wish I was on a date.

The food was good enough, not amazing, but not terrible. 

They seem to have specialities as well which is good for me since I don't want to spend 20+ per entree if I can get the same entree/presentation elsewhere.

I can't remember the other dishes we had, but we got this shrimp eggroll cocktail looking appetizer and it was TO DIE FOR! it was very cute as well. 

I'll be back. ENJOY!

I left my debit card at the restaurant. After my payment, i stayed in the restaurant for awhile.they should have plenty of to tell me that i forgot to pick up my card .however, they didnt inform me of anything untill i made two calls after i left. I called them twice about my lost card. They finally admitted that they have my debit card. This is disappointing. I cant believe they are so dishonest. I will NEVER recommend it to anyone.

Had lunch there this week. 
I had the Rama the King with chicken. It was spicy from the red curry but not overly so. The peanut sauce was the star of the dish and the veggies were cooked well. 
It was simple, cooked well, and tasty. It may not be the fanciest place on the strip but the price is good and the food and atmosphere are worth the visit.

We ordered 2 dishes - one came warm, the other came cold. The rice also came cold. We told the waitress and she took the food back, only to return with both luke warm.  The manager stood on a chair to put candles on the wall, but never wiped it off. Everything was overpriced. Any other restaurant would be half the price. Nice people, but very unprofessional. No, I will not return.

We were looking for thai food after walking in strip for hours and SEA  was the closest...we opted for it even though the rating was not very high....so I was pleasantly surprised when I entered the place... 

Ambience - 11/10. I sat near a pool with Buddha statue, floating candles & lotuses. 

Starters - By far the best spring rolls and sauce I have eaten

Entree - cashew nut gravy and fried rice. Loved the mild flavour of rice and the cashew nut gravy as well.

Service 8/10
- out server was very attentive ^_^

Papaya salad 6/10
- it was big and good just not spicy enough(yes we even asked for it to be spicier) 
Chao Tom 4/10
- very bland but big 
Bun rieu 3/10
- this is one of my favorite Vietnamese dishes but I've had better. It's really not great in taste it has more eggs then anything. And wayyyy to much fried onion. Broth didn't taste like it is suppose for bun rieu broth.

The greeting:  official oriental greeting and the hostess never broke character...excellent.  Waitress was also was very "official" and very attentive, bowing when greeting me and when offering the check.

So nice to see Excellent service!

Food:  i only had the dumplings and soft shell crab appetizers since I wasn't too hungry.  Dumplings were very good and a god value for the money. Soft shell crab was outstanding!! I am a soft shell crab nut and found this to be some of the best I've tasted.  Not greasy at all and again, a very good value.

Will definitely bring the family and friends back here for the full experience.
This a small restaurant located in the rear of ballys I recommend making reservations. The food was excellent and so was the service. We had a blast everyone was super nice from beginning to end

I went here twice and I had high expectations for this restaurant, but it is always disappointing.

FOOD: The Malay Curry is highly recommended here because it was voted #1 on CNN. The flavor was great, but the sweet potato was undercooked and too hard to eat. The Pad Thai was also recommended, but this time the noodles were undercooked. I tried a few other dishes, but everything failed to impress me. The food is overpriced, food is not cooked properly, and presentation is okay.

DRINK: Bottle service is very popular here among customers.

ATMOSPHERE: The seating area around the pond is beautiful, but if you end up with a regular table it is cramped and the table is plain. The service here was horrible. It is categorized as a find dining restaurant, but everyone is unfriendly. Many of the larger dishes should have a serving spoon to share, but they did not provide it. When I asked for a serving spoon, they gave me attitude and returned with a small spoon making it difficult to scoop the food. My table had ordered a soup that is served in an open flamed pot, the flame kept going out from the draft of the wind, so when we asked the manager to light the pot again, he was unwilling to help.

If I could give 4 stars for service I would but i have to give a 3 as the food itself was lack luster. The crab ragoons had very little crab in them. That said the sweet and sour sauce was outstanding. The Pad Thai was mainly noodle without the typical extras that make it texturely satisfying; bean sprouts, peanuts, etc. It also lacked any heat at all. Overall, nice atmosphere, good staff, but just ok food.

Three big reasons this place knocked it out of the park, IMO:
1) I had an incredible spicy seafood salad with squid, octopus, shrimp, scallion, cilantro, some kind of funky-lacy-semi-rubbery mushroom that I'd never seen or tasted before, lime-hot pepper dressing, and a few other things.  Without a doubt the best salad I have ever tasted, just bursting with fresh flavor.
2) With that, as a perfect complement, I enjoyed coconut shrimp that was sweet, crispy, and cooked just right.
3) Finally, my dining companion had  Pad Thai, which he said was boring.  This is a true sign of Thai cuisine perfection, because anyone with taste buds and some dining experience knows that Pad Thai is basically a boring dish.  It's Thai comfort food, and usually, when prepared in the traditional way, is less exciting than a good meat loaf.

The restaurant was also very elegant and pretty in an understated way, and our server was very friendly and efficient.  This place is on my go-to list for Vegas dining.

We really liked the ambiance of the restaurant, Buddha status adds extra Asian feel.
We ordered Tup Tim Fritters( Crispy shrimp-chicken dumplings), Drunken men's noodle, Crispy pork belly, Pineapple curry duck. Drunken men's noodle was very tasty(Stir fried broad noodle) and pineapple curry duck was good also. But it doesn't come with rice unless you ask for it. Crispy pork belly was very salty, didn't enjoy that much. 

Our problem was service, we ordered bottle of wine before we order the meal. It came out when we almost finish the meal. We'd been asking about the wine to be served to waitress several times during the meal but no responses made until we speak to the manager. Still I cannot understand why serving bottle of wine delayed so much.
The food was yummy and the decor was very beautiful. I just think the entrees should be $5 cheaper. I think $18 for pho or fried rice is just too much.

Husband took me here for my birthday dinner. The restaurant absolutely beautiful. Sat in the Buddha section & made 2 wishes (even though I have everything I want in life :). The food is delicious definitely worth the high price. Service was great & quick 

I recommend the honey walnut shrimp appetizer & the fritter. 

Pad Thai is average (a little on the dry side) masamun curry is delicious & a must try is the pork chop! 

We will definitely be coming back soon!

The food here was very good, to start with. We had pad Thai and a Penang curry. Both were very well prepared and very tasty.

What was disappointing was the service. We expected a wait at the door, given the weekend of the CES conference and that's what we got (despite being near 9pm). But after maybe 20 minutes we were seated next to the pond inside, which was nice.

Unfortunately, our waitress seemed disinterested in us, instead paying more attention to other tables while taking our orders. We later had our food come out (bit of a delay, but again expected) but delivered without cutlery, so we had to sit and look at our food until we could finally grab one of the waitstaffs attention to provide us with cutlery.

After we had finished our mains and asked for the check, we again waited another 15 minutes for it to be delivered - at this point the restaurant was barely half full.

It redeemed itself with the food, otherwise the experience wasn't great, especially considering the price.
Amazing food and atmosphere and very accommodating to vegans! Would definitely visit again!

The food was disappointing as we really love Thai food. We got the Malay curry which was the best thing on the menu but had very little curry and too much other items in it. We also got the pineapple fried rice, pad Thai, chicken satay and honey walnut shrimp. Nothing really stood out except the Malay curry and the prices are expensive even for Vegas prices.  One thing I thought was horrible was we had one baby 8 months old a 3 year old and 3 adults. They automatically put on 20% gratuity due to party of 5. It's listed on the menu but a baby really?  I now realize why the service was none existent as they already got the tip.
I ordered the panang curry with beef which was pretty good not spicy, someone else got the basil with shrimp n beef and it was tasty. Two others had the pad Thai and they all enjoyed it.

This place was pretty good! They have Thai and Vietnamese options. I always try the basics when I try a new Asian restaurant. I ordered the Pho Tai (rare steak) and my hubs ordered the Chicken Phad Thai. Doesn't get any easier than this. EVERYTHING was delicious! My Pho came with a VERY GENEROUS serving of broth, noodles and rare steak. On the side I was given bean sprouts, basil and jalapenos. I had to ask for a serving of their chili sauces, and they were a perfect addition. I couldn't get enough. I was stuffed to the brim and still had leftovers. My hubs loved his phad thai. Perfect combination of sweet, spicy and peanutty-ness. The ambiance was very mellow and chill. Very modern Asian feel. Our booth was in a corner so had to slide all the way over to get some privacy from the booth right next to us. They had some fresh roses placed on the tables and fake candles to add to the mood. Seating was comfortable. BUT this place is a little PRICY. Ok, a lot pricy. My Pho was a whopping $15, and my hubs Phad Thai was $17 even though he asked them to hold the shrimp in his dish. I think if someone requests to withhold a major ingredient the price should be lesson (like an easy $2 less or something). It's located in the Bally's Casino and Hotel next to a Steak House and Cantina. Would probably not go again just because of the price. I can get delicious thai or vietnamese food anywhere else for half the price that I paid here. ENJOY - 'cause I DID! :)

It's located in Bally's. 
We ordered take out Sunday afternoon Sept. 7. 

Crab rice- was 3.5/5  okay to good. 
Tom yum soup-  solid flavor.
Seafood noodle soup- spicy. Not very much noodles provided. 
Mango sticky rice- good.

Total $73

You can only get away with this kind of overpricing in Vegas.  Many Thai restaurants elsewhere would have much lower prices for exact same items. The restaurant was empty when we pickup the food. 

Negative- for take out, they put the soups in plastic cylinder containers. It's fine for the tom yum soup but for the noodle soup, it doesn't work very well. They provide the noodles in a separate SQUARE  styrofoam container.
 
You can't throw in the noodles with the soup container because it would be really awkward to eat the noodle soup out of. I had to pour the soup into the square container for the noodles which was a bad noodle eating experience. For a place that charges $20 for noodle soup, you would think they understand from a consumer perspective of the logistics of eating the noodle soup. They don't.

Most places have bowl containers so you can put the noodles into the soup and have a proper noodle eating experience. Such containers can be bought bulk with a price of .20 cents a bowl. Maybe they have little experience with take out food and the eating experience with it. 

Asian noodle soups tend to be around $8-12, for vegas pricing I'd accept $10-15. NOT $18-20. 
Crab rice was $26--crab is not that luxury of an item in vegas so very over priced. Should be about $18. 

Overall, really over price for what you are eating. Food is ok. You can get a much better food experience for the same price points at other places. I'll predict they wont survive here. The price point is not in sync with Bally's price point demographic and it would be silly for people from other casinos to come eat there. 

Will not eat there again unless it was free or they lower their prices to a normal level.

I'm so happy we stumbled upon this restaurant the night before we left Vegas. It is a serene escape from the craziness that is Vegas. My husband had Pad Thai, which was perfectly seasoned and a large portion. I had seafood Pho, which was much better than what we get here in Philly. Not oversalted or overseasoned, and loaded with seafood. A great experience, not cheap, as nothing is in Vegas, but good authentic Thai cuisine with great service.

After 20 hrs of not eating, and well not being that hungry...we decided to get some food.  Asian food sounded good so we came here.  The decor was nice, with a fountain in the middle that reminds you even teh divey places in Vegas are done up nice.

Most importanly though, the food was SOLID!  I had the Pho and I thought it was pretty darn good.  My other friend also had the Pho and thought it was good, and we aren't Pho beginners either...experts almost.  I had the brisket and meatball pho for reference.  Ask for the sauces tho as they might forget.  

Aside from Vietnamese food, the Thai food on the other side of the menu was also Bomb.com!  My friend odered the chicken pad see eew and it I thought it was pretty darn good.  Smokey and flavorful!!!

Service was good, but it wasn't too busy either.  It was a bit pricey for what it was...but then again its VEGAS!!!
Awesome food. Outstanding service. Very relaxing atmosphere. Will be going back for great Thai food. Put this on your Vegas list.

Delicious food, good service, reasonable prices, lovely atmosphere. Win, win. Plus we got a 30% off coupon from the half price ticket booth right at the Bally's marketplace. If you are staying in or near Bally's, definitely check it out!

We come Vegas 2times a week due to our job. Try restaurant everywhere of course. The high price here is not surprising to me. It's Vegas. And it's not the food court downstairs. Even the foot long subway downstairs is 10bucks. So I won't complaint it's expensive. The decor is very modern and cozy. We were seated right away. Service is very sweet and professional.  Everything I mentioned by now is 4-5stars. Food came out in 35minutes.  I ordered green curry hubby ordered pork chop.  The curry is so salty I finished every piece of the rice and 3glasses of water and left most of the food.  I will try to steak house next door next time when we stay here again.

absolutely lethargic, inexcusable and pathetic service, take ur money somewhere else, after 20 mins of waiting t the table there was no sign if service, even after complaining to the person in charge nothing changed, seriously expect people to shell $16 per dish with this sort if sloppy service..one of our worst experiences at a thai restaurant ever.

My meal here exceeded any Thai dish I've ordered anywhere else... ever. 

I came here with a group, and after making a reservation for 7:30, we learned we could have gotten away without one. It was fairly empty at 7:30 and didn't start picking up until about the time we were leaving. 

It seemed appropriate to order the Drunken Man's Noodle (Pad See Maow) with vegetables and it was absolutely heavenly. Everyone at the table tried some and really loved it. The basil in the sauce is just perfectly balanced.

Ambiance was dark and upscale. This would make a perfect couples/date spot. Service was great - a little slow once we got to the end of our meal, but overall very good. I hope to one day find a Drunken Man's Noodle that compares to this one.

So glad we found this. Staying at New York New York and was craving something zen and Asian.  Yelp saved the day to decipher through all the best places around. 20 minute walk on the strip to Bally's with a little help from AppleWatch and opentable. Wasn't very busy which scared me.  Not to worry it was AMAZING. 

We started with fritters!  Best ever.  Nice crispy dumplings on a slew with some sweet Thai sauce. For dinner we had pad Thai and Panang Curry.  Both great. Come with an appetite.  Hope this helps get through all the hundreds of great places in Vegas.
Really tasty thai food, and lovely atmosphere with great service. The prices are a bit high, but it was nice to get away from the casino vibe and enjoy a calm meal. I will definitely go back.

Service is very fast and friendly. I had a few questions before i ordered and the waiter did a good job explaining things. I ordered the basil chicken. I was worried it might be spicy but he asked me 1 to 5 how spicy i want it.  I think that was nice. And my wife ordered the short ribs. The food was really good. Food was a little pricey but it tasted good. The restaurant had some really good decor.

Taste is amazing! Had the Red Island Curry and it was the best I've ever had. Volcanic Chicken also very good. Don't like that rice does not come with any of the entres but a minor detail. Must have spot in Vegas.
Delicious food great atmosphere no long waits like some vegas restaurants. Make sure the buy the groupon

"I will take the short ribs home and can cook them!".  This is what my girlfriend said to me after one bite.

I purchased a rather expensive Groupon (50 for 78).  Complete waste of money.

The place itself is nice.  What you would expect from a casino restaurant that considers itself on the mid to higher end.

The service, although a little aggressive, is decent.  

The beer - I thought they would have at least one Thai beer, but we are told they share the beer menu with BLT...ok not the end of the world.

The food is awful, when considering how much this meal cost me.  If we had paid 20 for both of us we would have given 3 stars.

Our Groupon gives us 2 appetizers (up to 14 each) and 2 dinners (up to 25 each).  One of the appetizers that appealed to us didn't qualify for the amount given, but we can pay extra and did. It isn't much money but the nickel and dime train is coming.  We ordered steamed dumplings and Honey Walnut Shrimp.  The dumplings came out luke warm and very dense, not pleasant.  We actually keep pushing the plate toward each other saying "you eat it". We ate them but only because we paid for them.  The Shrimp dish, recommended by the server, is decent and maybe the star of our meal. They came hot, didn't have a ton of favor, but a nice spice.

Our dinners (UGH) - Short ribs and at the server recommendation Panang Duck (4 dollars above my 25 threshold). "Rice doesn't come with your meal.  Would you like some?"....Tooot Tooot! Sure, we will pay extra for rice.

The meals come out and as my girlfriend takes the first bite she says "They aren't cooked.  I will take the short ribs home and can cook them!".  The girl is Filipino and her family lives for short ribs.

I take a bite of my duck - white un-rendered fat with rubbery skin.  I stopped after taking a second bite of the dish.  What appear to be frozen vegetables used in the dish aren't real tasty. No carry out box needed.

I would have thought the server might ask about why I didn't want to take it home or why we were finished 5 minutes after it came out but as goes life.

So -  The Groupon was 50, we did have 1 beer and 1 Coke, plus upsells brought me to another 30 dollars plus tip on the 80, bringing our meal to almost 100.

We ended up going to Earl of sandwich at Planet Hollywood after to eat.  Don't waste your money here. Much better can be had for far less money.

Ate here twice in two days because it was so good.  The first day, I ordered the Pad Thai with duck.  Portion was huge but very tasty. The second day, I ordered a green curry dish based on the waiters recommendation, and it was one of the best meals I've ever eaten.  Service is outstanding and really helps make the experience.

Not bad. Although the decorations portay tranquility, but the ambience is far from tranquil. Noise level is medium high. Not a fine dining. Food is meh... even the chef special. We have an okay experience except when a server talked while standing closely between me and my husband. His saliva spray onto our faces and to our drinks. We asked for another drinks. He brought the drinks and food and talked to us while holding them under his mouth....yuckkk .... Helpless... I didn't want to hurt his feeling by telling him but at the same time.... Yaiiikkksss....

We had a reservation for 7 pm
And were seated promptly - that was nice. The service was painfully slow. We finished dinner at 9:00pm because of the delayed service and mix ups on serving. The food is overpriced with a hint of Thai...the desserts menu is a joke...
Never going back.

Food....mmmm...yum.  the decor...so cute!  i loved the water features and the bubble chairs!  The food was great and the service perfect.  Very attentive.  We stopped in for a quick lunch before exploring Vegas.  We too ran into it by accident.  score one for SEA!

The environment is awesome, the Tom Yum soup is very good, the salads are all pretty heavily dressed, and the salmon I got is drier than other salmons I had before. 

You can get the coupon from the coupon place on the street so everything 30% off.

Make sure to check Groupon to see if they still have their coupon going on to maximize your value when coming to SEA: The Thai Experience. The pricing otherwise is a little expensive for the amount of food you get, and also the quality.

The atmosphere and decor of this place bumps this rating up from just an average restaurant.  One of my favorite decorations that stood out to me was a still pond which makes you feel very calm and zen. It looked absolutely beautiful. The seating was comfortable. Once again, this restaurant looked very nice and gave off a calm ambiance, as if you were transported in another place, away from all of the craziness of the Las Vegas strip!

The service was pretty nice and attentive. They were polite and helpful in assisting my party on what to get. The drinks were consistently refilled and we were checked on regularly. 

The food is where the experience fell a little short. Some of it was good, but for the most part, the quality of food is average. Nothing really popped out at me in terms of flavor, but it was still a decent experience. I would say that the appetizers were better than the entrees. 

For the appetizers, I decided to get some stuffed crab rangoons which was pretty good. The main entree I went with was the pad see ew, and it was average at best. Some of my friends ordered the pad Thai and they said the same thing. 

The atmosphere and ambiance make up for the lacking food, but it definitely holds value if you can find some coupons that knock the price down a little bit! On Groupon, the coupon I got was 2 appetizers and 2 entrees for $49, which was a pretty decent deal!

The worst Thai experience ever. The food is awful and way over priced. You can get better Thai food and cheaper else where. The waitress lost our cc and the management didn't even offer us anything for our inconvenience. I normally don't write reviews but I had to warn others. Dine at your own risk.

Nice place with a decent, somewhat clich√©d environment that mimics a lot of newer Thai restaurants in other cities.  However, my meal was tasty and perfectly spiced.  I had a bowl of Tom Yum and some shrimp curry for my entree.  The service was friendly and quick.  Would definitely go back if I were in the neighborhood.

The place was awesome, it had very cool lighting and seating we got to sit by the water it was pretty sweet. The food and service were great as well! We got the crab wantons, coconut spring rolls, shrimp pad thai, and the beef pad seew(sp?) everything was delicious the crab wanton had a lime vinaigrette that could put on anything! The pad thai was yummy as well although I would have preferred the chicken. The beef padsew was the best one i've ever tasted!! Overall great atmosphere, service and food!

Wonderful, calm and relax ambiance. This is my favorite in Las Vegas. It's located in Balley Hotel and Casino

The atmosphere is really nice and cool. All of the staff are friendly and look wonderful in the modern Thai style.

Food here is really amazing!!! The cleanness of the place and food plate are great!!! Pat, you have done a wonderful job!!!

I really recommend to try Crab meat fried rice. You won't regret.
Came here with a friend - we had groupons and it was a fantastic experience at a good value. I absolutely love Thai food and had no complaints whatsoever about this location

I was looking forward to this restaurant because when someone puts the word Experience in the title you think its going to be awesome to the third power.  Well for sure borderline but not quite authentic.  Sometimes I hate that I compare foods to where they originate from because it can ruin the "experience".  I mean overall it was not bad just very generic.  I ordered the papaya salad which should have a little kick to it and with fresh shrimp, this one had dried inedible shrimp and zero kick.  I ordered the prawns and glass noodles, the prawns were delightful but the glass noodles just tasted like they were mixed with a little soy sauce.  Also tried the calamari which was very good.  The Thai tea was good as well.  I though it was odd that there was not an offering of Thai chili, I requested some and was brought back some in a glass cup.  
The restaurant is cozy and has a really nice atmosphere, the servers were gracious and helpful, pricing is a bit ridiculous but so is most pricing of restaurants now in Las Vegas strip area.
Great food, quick service, a little noisy for my taste.  We had Pad Thai and Pad See Yew, which were both done correctly.  Nothing particulary remarkable, but no surprises either.

I've had amazing Thai food in many different places. I've never actually been to Thailand, but I've eaten Thai food in Singapore and Australia, as well as here in America.

I have to say the Thai food I ate here is the MOST like the Thai food I ate on that side of the planet. They really have the flavors of authentic Thai cuisine down in a way that most American Thai places don't.

The waitstaff were great. We actually went here three days in a row because the place was so good. Considering it's one of only two options actually inside Bally's (Where the other choice is an over-priced crappy steakhouse), they get an A+ in my book.

I have been to this restaurant several times but have never left a review. I give it 4 stars only because of the price of the dishes. It's a bit pricey, but hey, it is in Bally's and this is the Las Vegas strip. On this visit, I had the spicy papaya salad, the honey walnut shrimp appetizer and Thai teaAll were delicious and I highly recommend! The ambiance is is dark and the music is chill/down tempo. I arrived as soon as it opened at 11:30 so it wasn't very busy which made service quick. I highly recommend this restaurant if you're on the strip and cannot make it to China Town. I will definitely be back!

I love Thai food and jumped at the opportunity to try a new Thai restaurant on the Strip when I saw it pop up on Groupon. Plus, who doesn't want to save a few bucks in Vegas whenever you can. The Groupon took about 40% off the regular price and gave us $100 to spend on four or more people. We ended up having five people and, of course given Vegas prices, had no problem reaching and exceeding that amount. In fact, my friend and I decided to share our plate of pad see ew to avoid leftovers and the five of us still hit $150 with four entrees, four drinks and a beer.

Of course, this happened to be the smallest portion of pad see ew that I've ever seen in all of my Thai eating days. Every other time I end up with enough leftover for at least one, if not two more meals, but this time I probably could have finished the whole plate. Aside from the size, the rest of the dish was perfect. Our waitress advised us to try the beef over the chicken and it was very tender and delicious. There was a perfect sauce to noodle ratio and I was very happy with the flavor. I don't care for Chinese broccoli but I liked that it was stacked on top of the dish instead of mixed in and my dining partner volunteered to eat the greens. At $22, I wouldn't say this dish is worth the price but it was tasty. My friends ordered a couple fried rices and the drunken noodles. It seemed like the fried rice dishes had the largest quantity of food.

As always, I loved my Thai iced tea, which was a bit pricier than usual at $5 but in line with Vegas prices.

The restaurant is small but has a nice vibe. It was relaxing until a very loud person was sat at the table next to us. Apparently, noise carries very well in here. 

Service was good at first but then our waitress seemed to disappear after she dropped the check off. We were in a hurry so it was a bit annoying that it took her so long to return to get the payment. We had to rush back to our hotel to get ready for our evening plans.

While in Vegas, my better half was looking for a Pho fix.  SEA at Bally's was the closest and we were happy with the decision. Yes, it is extremely pricey for what it is, but that's Vegas...

Thai cuisine on one side of the menu and Viet on the other.  BH had pho, which he said was good. I went with one of my Thai standbys, drunken noodles which was good and spicy, as requested.  Dinner for two: drinks, appetizer and 2 entrees was $90 after tax and tip.  Service was pleasant, no complaints there.

(TIP:  ask for the sauce tray which includes siriracha and hoisin sauce)
Good food although very spicy.  Good service and ambient.  Good for kids too, a bowl of rice is always a success with them

OKAY - so not the BEST Thai food I've ever had but the restaurant is lovely.  Too bad it's located in a smelly casino on the Vegas Strip.

Fried calamari was decent - not too overdone but the sauce was delicious!  I had the pork chops and my son had the duck confit.  Portions are decent sized but the prices are BIG, overall the food was quite good.  $8.00 for edamame when it should only be $3.00, crazy.  You are definitely paying for the location.

For example I would normally have the Pad Thaii in addition to a main dish  but for the price of over $20.- I would not pay.  Besides when I saw the reviews for blah Pad Thai, I refused.  

Service was terrific but as I mentioned having to walk thru a smelly smoke filled casino to get there is a turn off.  Yes, I'm in Vegas and don't gamble or smoke but I do eat.

It was a treat to go to an upscale expensive restaurant , but I would do go again.

Decent restaurant serving Thai and Vietnamese dishes.  The menu has broad selection of noodles, soups, rice dishes, curries, and pho.  You can choose from chicken, beef, tofu, and shrimp with the various noodle and rice selections. 

We had lunch and was seated next to a nice indoor lotus pond with a stone Buddha and paper lanterns hanging from the ceiling.  Wife ordered the chicken pineapple fried rice, which was cooked well and had decent "wok breath."  I liked it more than she did.  The rice wasn't dry at all and I liked the saut√© cashews, scallions, eggs, and pineapple chunks that gave acidity to balance the savory.

I ordered the spicy SEA noodles, which came as a pile of wide rice noodles mixed with shrimp, tofu, bean sprouts  and squid.  It was surrounded by a pool of dark soy sauce with a vinegary aftertaste, similar to tamarind.  The flavors were bold, but the sauce overwhelmed slightly. I probably should have gotten the Drunken noodles or spicy seafood soup noodles.

Still, good place to grab lunch in a dark intimate setting.  Good service too.  Just watch out for over-sauced dishes.

This is the most expensive Thai restaurant on the Strip. $21 for a fried rice, and was very salty. Service was ok, but the food leaves a lot to be desired considering spending over $100 on two meals, and tea.

Ordered a  Mai Tai for my first drink. HORRIBLE!!! Sent it back. Not sure they knew what a Mai Tai was given the drink they brought out.  Served in a regular glass, med. size with 1 lemon garnish. Color was off as well.  
Loud kids playing on the swing up front. REALLY!!

Waitress was super sweet.
Food was really good. 2 thumbs up to the cook. 

Won't be back.

This first time I take dinner at thai rest in Las Vegas ,me and girl friend got 30% disc from tix for tonight counter just only paid $2 as they suggest got dinner before show(jubilee) ,we ordered volcano chicken ,patting green curry and Tom yam soup and dessert ice cream with fried banana  the taste was delicious ,little bit over price but luckily got 30% disc ,service was oke ,clean,nice decor . We love it .we will come back next time
The jungle Curry and the lemon chicken we're great. The place is beautiful inside. Nice and quiet

Pho was not even hot.

How do you mess that up? Our meat could barely cook in it..
 

40 dollars for lukewarm pho and cheese ragoon???

Waste of money

Sea Thai is hidden away in a nook between a Margarita joint and yet another steakhouse in Paris, right by the hallway when you come through when you walk over from Bally's. 

The atmosphere and service were both just a pleasure. Seating surrounds a rectangular pool with a large statue of the Compassionate Buddha, with a screen behind it with a lotus flower graphic on it. Lighting is dim, tasteful and the atmosphere is contributed to by candlelit wall sconces. 

Unique wooden tables for 2 surround the pool, with more traditional seating along the walls.

We especially appreciated, being Vegetarian, that every meal had a tofu option. In Vegas, that's a rarity!

The only thing that kept this from a 5 star for me was that the food didn't actually taste Thai! I just assume that they removed the spice form the recipe to cater to the generic palate's of the average visitor. Don't get me wrong though, the food was very good and I'd go again...I'll just remember to ask for spicy next time!

The service: Absolutely amazing! The waiters Gong and Mutty were very attentive, friendly and so professional. I was very impressed by their level of service. Such a rare find on the LV Strip.

The food: The quality was exceptional and the food was authentic- quite possibly the best crab Rangoon I've tried! The mango sticky rice was delicious and the presentation was so lovely.

The ambiance: The restaurant is beautiful and tranquil. We were seated by the pond and it was a relaxing dining atmosphere. 

A well-deserved five stars - Sea exceeded my expectations!

Like Jodie Z said..."the Thai experience you do not want"... For the price, this is not a good place to go. There are other Thai locations that advertise a "Thai" experience without the fusion that this place had. I asked for a Singha or a Tiger... nope... budweiser or Stella....? Not even a Heiniken... the food was subpar with what I've had at other Thai restaurants, not spicy enough, too much coconut, too much cream, small portions. . . 

The waitress was nice, but it's not worth going again. I had other friends go back (not sure why) I think because it's in the casino and it's not gastropub or a burger. 

I've noticed a trend in the reviews and who says yay and who says nay, and I am definitely part of the nay group. 

Maybe next time...

First off... this place is absolutely gorgeous! I've seen it on Groupon forever and finally made it out to try it. It's hidden in the corner of Bally's little restaurant row. The music surprisingly had no Pacific Islander reference, but it wasn't over powering.  

Our server Mutty engaged in fun conversation and gave us genuine recommendations. I decided to choose a cocktail out of my norm "Bee Gee's", and the honey taste was too strong for me and had to trade that in for the BLT cocktail which didn't disappoint at all! 

On to the grub! 
Crispy ginger calamari- lightly battered, served with a sweet cocktail sauce. Sauce threw me off, just a little too sweet like me

Crab Rangoon- served on a slice of cucumber. Cream cheese galore

Fritters- had and still have no idea what this is, lol, but it's served on skewers with sweet Thai chili sauce 

Spicy basil shrimp fried rice- I licked the bowl clean, enough said

Malaysia curry- this won a reward from Food by CNN! So we had to try it! I also finished this clean! Doesn't come with rice, maybe it's served a la cart. 

The serving sizes are small for the price, but tasty to say the least. I'd like to try a few more things on the menu next time. I'll make sure I have a Groupon for that too!

The restaurant is just ok. Ordered a beef noodle soup and its ok... a big serving but nothing special about it. Ambiance is nice but service was a bit slow. Bally's is very limited on food selection and that's more the reason why we decided on this spot. Nothing great here. If you have the time, there are tons of other great restaurants on the strip!

Just want to start off by saying that my dad is Vietnamese and a chef so I grew up in kitchens and the love and appreciation of food was instilled in me at a very young age. 

I ordered the chicken malay massaman curry and it was PERFECT, that alone deserves 5 stars. It was so good I asked the waiter to give my compliments to chef, so if your looking for curry this place will not disappoint. Me and my girlfriend shared an order of 4 egg rolls and they were tasty, they however come with a small amount of sauce for dipping. My girl ordered the chicken classic teriyaki which she really liked, I tried it and it tasted ok. Just as a heads up none of the dishes come with sides so we both had to add sides of white steamed rice. For some reason the prices from their online menu don't seem to match the actual prices from what I can remember seeing in the restaurant. 

The vibe of the restaurant was really nice, it was tucked away in a corner of the Paris Las Vegas Casino so it was away from most of the crowd. There's also some seating in the middle that surrounds a water pond with water lilies and a beautiful statue of Buddha. We were sat away from this and when asked if we could sit by the water they moved us with no hesitation.

I thought this place was amazing! The food came fairly quickly, the service staff was excellent, the dining atmosphere is incredible and beautiful, the pricing is great, and the food was outstanding! I have no idea why this restaurant is rated only 3 1/2 stars. Also, there are plenty of options for those who are vegan or gluten sensitive. That was also a big plus for me.

I'm here with my wife right now and I'm taking the time to write this post to say that the food is excellent! We recommend the the spicy beef salad and the Tom yum Kun. Service was also excellent! Got seated right away and all our food was on the table in less than 10mins. Ambiance was fitting and the lotus pound in the middle of the restaurant offers a peaceful experience.    Exquisite!

I heard of this venue from groupon, for which I purchased a 41$ voucher for two appetizers and two entr√©es for 2 people. 

This thai restaurant was located in the Bally hotel and casino- somewhat really hard to find. We got there pretty late @ around 10 pm, but the staff was very accomodating and still took out order even though they were near closing time. Since we came in late, we ordered our entr√©es to go. However, the decor was breathtaking with a man made pond sitting in the middle of the restaurant with Thai statues. 

Food: we started with appetizers: 
Po-pia sod (2/5) fresh vegetarian roll wrapped in rice paper served in pieces and a chilli dipping sauce - I didn't find anything out of the ordinary for this dish -very typical flavours;
Stuffed crab Rangoon (2/5)- crab and cream cheese filled fried Wonton- I really didn't enjoy the cream cheese, it didn't compliment well with the crab.
Our main entr√©es: (these entr√©es were not served with rice which you had to order separately)
Seafood combo (2/5)-shrimp, scallop, Tilapia curry- I found the scallops were not well cooked and seasoning was lacking. This was one of the more expensive items on the menu that was recommended by the waitress- I didn't enjoy it at all.
Tofu Pad Thai (3/5)-came with flat noodles, raw mango strips and cooked red peppers. I liked that this dish came with noodles. Mango was a fresh touch to the dish in combination with the red peppers.

Thoughts: I thought the groupon was great for the quantity of food we got and in presentation but in terms of the food quality, I expected better. Average restaurant on the strip!

We made reservations for my birthday at 730pm and when we arrived on time the Manager named "O" said that there was not a table because everyone else had a reaervation at 730. How is it possible that they would fill up all the tables and overbook knowing that someone would be left out. He proceeded to argue with us that we were wrong for expecting to have a table at the time we reserved... he was absolutely incredulent, unapologetic, rude and disrespectful. As good as the food is here we will not be back and would recommend that you spend your hard earned money somewhere else.

Horrible! Don't be tricked by the beautiful decor. Service is bad and food is bad. We came there with a travel zoo certificate and told the waitress at the time of ordering. We also ordered a separate crab dish aside from the certificate and discussed what the dish included. Dishes arrived at the table and none tasted good. We didn't complain although we should have. Then arrived the much awaited crab dish. No crab? I'm sorry where is the crab? "Oh the kitchen forgot. Let me take your plate." Return with 2 crab claw halves. "I gave you more shrimp." I'm sorry but the shrimp wasn't what was missing and the dish was $38. It also didn't taste good. To make things even worse, we were given our bill that was $18 over what it should have been. Luckily we looked at the bill before paying. There was a charge on the bill that said open table. We questioned a waiter who walked by about what this meant. He said he didn't know but would get our waitress. She came over and became argumentative. "Your certificate didn't include everything. You still owe $3 on this dish and $10 on another..." I'm sorry but that's not what the Travelzoo said. She then walks away with the bill and comes back and all of a sudden the open table charge had disappeared and we were charged appropriately.  She says, "It was the manager's fault. He thought you had another certificate." First of all, we never saw a manager and you scanned our phone so knew exactly what our offer was. She never apologized and I do believe that she was trying to pocket the extra cash. We will never go back there. The food was subpar and the service was slimy!

I'm the biggest lover of Thai food and this place did not disappointment. My girls and I were in Vegas for a bachelorette party and decided to eat here for lunch. The food was very good and the portion sizes were large. The place was a bit pricy for Thai food most items were over $20, but I think most places on the strip in vegas were pricy.  But I highly recommend to try this place  if  you are in Vegas and love Thai food. You will not be disappointed!

This place was an excellent find. My gf and I went here on a Saturday night around 8:00pm and got a great seat right by that relaxing lily pond. The wait staff was very nice and we got to use our Groupon, which was a great deal. Food was fascinating and delicious. Will definitely be returning during our next trip!

I've got to say, this was one of my favorite meals in Vegas. I've never been to the one in New York, or feel very snobby about Thai food, so I give this two thumbs up, a satisfied tummy and four stars. 

First of all, the interior design is incredible. It's almost as if you are dining inside a fountain with Buddha. The seats are level with the water feature, and a statue garnishes the very end of the pool. 

We had a large group, so they accommodated us without a reservation in their back group seating area behind privacy screens. The service was simply amazing. They all treated us like kings. Very attentive and suggestive. 

The food was phenomenal. They put all kind of good stuff in their dishes like basil and chilies. They've got a great wine selection, and very reasonable prices for what you pay in Vegas.
Nothing special, slow service and they are still waiting for their liquor license. For the price I can think of better options for food.

Great customer service!!!!! 

Okay I recommend to get the Drunken men noodles, it has a mix of mango, tomatoes, green and red peppers and the noodles is not your typical string noodles they are thin wide if hat makes sense. If you are in Vegas and are in the mood of Thai food come here it's inside the Bally's hotel all the way to far end of the floor. I hope this helps.

Ambience was great but food was pretty average. A little too classy (and hence too pricey) for me personally but it was ok since I went there to celebrate an important occasion.  What threw me off was the fact they charged 20% gratuity for 2 of us since it was the holiday season.
Our absolute favorite Thai restaurant! Being half Thai, I know good Thai food. Not sure why others have rated so poorly, but this place is great.

We were staying at Bally's when we decided to try this place. It's a quaint restaurant with very nice service and ambience. You are made to sit besides this small water body with a buddha statue... Adds to a really good experience.

Coming to the food... Excellent! Such flavourful Pad Thai noodles and basil chicken. Really great food and experience all in all.

We just ate at this hidden gem yesterday, and it was awesome. We will definitely go again. For appetizers, we ordered the chicken satay, and a crispy shrimp with walnuts. Both tasted very good and we enjoyed every single bite. 
For an entree, the duck massaman curry was ordered and the special seared salmon. The duck curry was Monnnnnay. It was so good, both the Hubbs and I were impressed with the taste. The duck tasted excellent with the curry. It said it comes with potatoes, specifically they are sweet potatoes, I was trying to find potatoes, as I love them and when I was unable to find one, my husband said it's probably sweet potatoes. Nevertheless, excellent dish
The seared salmon sat on top of a mixed mango salad. The presentation of the dish was very nice and the salmon, although cooked well done, was still tasty. We were both very impressed with the food. 
The ambience is also great. Quiet and very relaxing, and still quite elegant. I am very surprised at the low star reviews as I thought it was very nice restaurant! 
Don't be scared and try this place, a bit pricey, but worth it!
If we didnt order 2 apps and 2 entrees I may have had room for dessert 
Service wise- no complaints!! Friendly and wonderful servers!
Really, really flavorful thai food! My husband and I loved it.

It was packed and service was ok .. one of the waitress was too rushing ..decent food though .. seemed overpriced like many of the things in Vegas ! Wud check out some other place next time . Good decor inside as well.

I went to SEA Thai with reservations. We arrived and all the tables were full. The Manager "O" said that all the tables that were seated had the same reservation time. I was told there would be a 20 to 30 min wait... We had show tickets.  Not only did he argue but he proceeded to insult myself and others in our party with sarcastic comments. Honestly, I have never experienced this level of disrespect and rudeness from any service provider and I have traveled all over the world. Don't  spend your money here. I won't be back.

Found this gem located in Ballys late at night. Decor is contemporary. Service was very attentive and not intrusive. Food hit just the right spot. Price was very reasonable since its on the strip. Basically 18 bucks per dish. It about 13 for off the strip so it's actually a steal!
Everything was fantastic! Great taste and great service! The hotel where it is located is a bit on the older side, but restaurant is fantastic!

Nice atmosphere, as you would expect on the strip. However, the food was just ok. The massaman curry was really turmeric heavy. The pad see ew had a good sauce but the gai lan was blanched instead of stir-fried with the noodles which made for flavorless gai lan. The duck confit was very good. I had a discount for a Groupon deal, so based on what I paid the value was fine. The reason I selected this deal was because the photos on their website lead you to believe it will be an "experience" with out of this world food with spectacular playing. None of the plating was particularly special. Needless to say I would never return to pay the exorbitant strip prices. I'll stick with my fave spot in Henderson.

We visited this establishment  during our recent trip to vegas.  We had a travelzoo voucher so we decided to try it.  Its located in Ballys, sort of hidden away.  Well its in fact a hidden gem.  The ambiance is very relaxing a tranquil, very good from the high stress daily Vegas fight.  We started with two appetizers, i ordered the lettuce wraps and the wife ordered the tup tim fritters.  The lettuce wraps are the best we ever had in our life, so flavorful.  The tup tim fritters were good as well, but no match for the wraps.  For our entrees i ordered the malay massaman curry and the wife had the ginger and pineapple stir fry.  Her was good but the Curry was absolutely fantastic.  Im not a curry person but it really blew my socks off.  Wife enjoyed hers, but she kept thinking and talking about the lettuce wraps.  The entire rest of the trip the wife kept wanting to go back for some lettuce wraps, just as a snack.  But we were staying in that hotel and i like to try something different each time during the trip.  Next time we will definately be stopping by again for some lettuce wraps.  Oh and the travelzoo voucher was just the icing on the cake money wise.  A definite recommendation while in Vegas!!

One of the best Thai restaurants i have been in. The food quality was very good and the service has been excellent. The lady was very friendly and attentive, even to a group of 6 people. The lightning however, has been a bit too dim as some of us were struggling to properly read the menu. But despite that i would definitely recommend paying a visit to this place if you love Thai food.

Boring ! Uneventful ! Told the server we were unhappy with Massam curry dish they said was rated "top 10"
They did nothing to resolve the problem.
ALL dishes were overpriced . Nothing tasted unique & nothing seasoned well . Bland as can be on EVERY
Entree. They are a huge waste of calories and pleasure .

On our last night in Vegas, before driving home, the Boyfriend and I were trying to decide where to eat.  We were tired and hungry and sitting in the hallway to the parking lot of Paris.  We turned around and saw a poster for SEA directly above our heads.  Something in my mind clicked and I realized that this was the sister restaurant for SEA in New York which was featured in Sex & the City but also, more importantly, for one of my favorite scenes in one of my favorite movies of all time: Garden State.  "umm...we're a Vietnamese restaurant?  We don't serve bread?"  "Can I get something to chew on?  F***, bamboo.  Whatever."

So it was decided that we would go to SEA for our final meal that weekend in Vegas.

I'd never had Vietnamese food before, so I stuck to my old standby, shrimp red curry and sticky rice, from the Thai said of the restaurant.  The shrimp was well cooked and the curry flavorful.  BF went for a Vietnamese noodle dish with steak.  Mine was very very good, however, the Vietnamese dish was outstanding.  I totally wished I'd gotten the same thing.  The noodles were delicate and the steak supremely flavorful and tender.

The atmosphere is great--I absolutely love sitting along the water, facing the statue.  I thought I would just explode quoting Garden State throughout dinner.  My one issue was that the lighting was dim and pleasant, but that there was no curtain separating the glaring kitchen lights from the rest of the eating area, some what taking away the dream light atmosphere.

Best of all, it didn't totally break the bank and was a truly delicious and memorable meal.  I love finding places like this along the strip!
Totally amazing!!!  I love curry and this si definitely the place to eat it at.  Perfect level of spiciness engulfed in creamy yet mild coconut flavor.  I will definitely be back

Beautiful place!
Great service!
The award winning curry dish is the best we ever ate.

Super cute place, great service but outrageously overpriced. Purchased a Groupon for $100 worth of food for 4. I understand prices are jacked up in Vegas (I paid $12 for a slice of pizza and a bottle of water...) but really $28 for shrimp drunken noodles?  

We got in for a 6pm reservation and requested to sit by the water feature - the place is nicely decorated and has a very serene cool vibe. We started off with the pork taro eggrolls, papaya salad and chicken tom yum soup. Eggrolls were ok, papaya salad was fresh and crisp just enough heat and the soup was good. For dinner we ordered the shrimp drunken noodles, chicken pineapple fried rice and beef garlic veggie stir fry. All in all, food is ok but portions are small for the price you pay. I've paid $8 for pineapple fried rice at 1 1/2 times the portion I got here. Before Groupon, our entire meal cost $133 - just a tad it high for what you get.

If not for the Groupon, I'm not sure if I would come back. Flavors of food were just ok but nothing to rave about. Don't get me wrong, I didn't leave hungry but for what's charged, I'm expecting phenomenal. I do have to say what they lack in food to price ratio, they sure make up in service! Service was excellent : friendly, fast and efficient.

Lovely relaxing place to eat away from the hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas strip and casinos. Tucked away inside Bally's casino and hotel, it is a nice ambiance.  I sat at a table right next to a shallow pool with a Buddha statue at the head of the pool. The food was good, fresh. I got tofu with ginger and vegetables with brown rice.  I also got lemongrass ginger tea and an Old Cuban mixed drink. They were delicious!!!!

Love me some great Thai Food...Came here with my hunny we had a great experience. The food was wonderful and very tasty. The seating was so relaxing. This place made my day....Will definitely come back.

Amazing food and service!!!  I had pad Thai,  crab rangoon, and steamed dumpling.   Shut up I didn't eat it all by myself!  It was delicious.  That's the only word to describe the food.   Quality and bursting with flavor.  Go go go go

I had really high hopes for this place. My boyfriend and I were in town and I wanted to have a nice dinner (reasonably priced of course). I found a travelzoo for this and we walked in about 9 pm. In Vegas, 9 pm is early. We were promptly seated and our waiter was attentive. They seemed to had just had a rush, I don't know, but good turned to not good. The waiter went on break and I almost thought they went to find a live chicken for our plate. It took that long. They then came and I had to remind them of our order. By the time the dishes got to our table, they were cold. We didn't even eat them. I felt bamboozled and I really would have liked a refund. 

The thai coffee was nice and good. Other than that, I wouldn't recommend this place.

The Vegas sea is nearly identical to the New York one, only with higher prices. The New York one has a better aura and scenery though as it is more entrancing. The food here is good, not amazing, but the server was super friendly and I really loved that. Their fried rice dishes are still the go-to here, along with their noodles so those would be my recommendations. The place is inside Bally's Hotel lobby all the way to the back so just a heads up if you're there looking for it.

Went during lunch on a Saturday and were the only people in the restaurant which should have clued us in. Don't get me wrong, the food was "okay" but for the price and service, not worth it. They kept bringing us the wrong drinks and then added extra dishes to our check that we didn't order. We think it was from the one other couple that came in after us....anyway, I got the drunken noodles and asked for medium spice, but I swear it was mild.

Online says they close at 12 AM on Wednesday (everyday). We came at 11:20 and it may be close to closing time, but we don't take long and either they should fix their website or change their hours. Waste of time navigating through the hotel only to be turned away. Also the door was still open with no close sign. If it was policy to turn people away, it felt more like my business was not wanted because they were almost closed. I'm a very unhappy non-customer. Reach out to me at xxperencexx@gmail.com if desired.

We tried it based on Yelp reviews, and are we ever glad that we did!  My husband ordered the Pad Thai and asked for level 3 and the Papaya Salad at level 5 - "Thai hot".  I ordered the sauteed vegetables with garlic sauce (came with rice on the side) at heat level 3.  We loved what we ordered, although I will admit that next time I will order heat/spiciness level 2 for myself.  I have to commend them:  the spiciness was not just "hot for hot's sake", but had real depth of flavor.  I will also say that the mango smoothie we had for dessert was the perfect calming point for my palate.  The restaurant was peaceful, lovely.  We were at a bench/table.  One really neat feature:  There was a large group dining in the side area and there are pivoting glass divider panels that the staff used that really cut down on sound transmission.  What a great thing to have.  I agree with other postings, it is not inexpensive, but I thought it was good value for the quality of food, service, ambiance and location.  We will return the next time we are near Bally's

This is a chic Thai restaurant that has a really nice South Beach ambience.  The food is just ok and we've had better at smaller hole-in-the-wall places. I recommend asking for a table next to the water feature and the big Buddha.

What a great experience we had at this restaurant!! When my friend offered to take me there for dinner I was hesitant at first.  I'm a meat & potatoes kinda girl, wasn't really sure about Thai food but I'm so glad I took a chance & went. I had the Honey Walnut Shrimp for my appetizer and it was so so good. I had fried rice with chicken as my entr√©e.  It was also very delicious. The service was superb in every way. Great food & service with reasonable prices makes it very easy to give this restaurant 5 stars!!

I take no pleasure in handing out low ratings and reviewing harshly, but in some cases its necessary. From the onset, I felt a certain unease as we, a group of six were seated by the door which I clearly asked not to be. The center piece of design was in the other sitting area and our guests were unable to observe the Buddha even though I asked the host to be seated elsewhere. Vegetable Spring Rolls were low quality and filled with some form of shredded kelp seagrass, nothing else. This item can be more readily accessible in aisle six, the frozen food department at your local grocer. The Vietnamese Shrimp Rolls, only fractionally better as the peanut sauce was good and the Almond Wontons lacked any form of flavor.  The entrees had a peculiar oder, from the spare ribs to the crab fried rice (an horrid upsell by the server, $26.00 for six ounces of rice and low quality, canned crab meat.) The Duck in Orange sauce was skimpy, just one pathetic sized leg and thigh for $26.00. The House Sake was atrocious, the garnish for all dishes was so sloppy and poorly plated. There seemed to be little or no professionalism from front of the house to the back of the house in their entire approach. They tacked on a 20% gratuity which is not uncommon for parties of five or more. Is an automatic tip a good reason to work your tables in such an uncaring and unprofessional manner?  Striving for a higher total bill cost is NOT the emphasis, but it was ay SEA the culinary experience from hell. After two hundred dollars and grumbling bellies I walked out mortified.

Food was ok, very slow service. The tom ka was probably the best dish we had, broth was surprisingly good, and pretty generous amount of seafood. The pad siew on the other hand was soggy and over cooked. unfortunately, the seafood pot had hardly any seafood, maybe they made a mistake and put most of it in the tom ka? The chicken satay was on the dry side. We chose this place because it was convenient, and not a very long wait.

I took a group of 11 to this Thai restaurant this last Sunday, January 15th around 6:30. We were all in the mood for Thai and since this restaurant was able to seat us we were happy.
 When we arrived at the table we were short a seat and asked for another one as there was an entire table in our area that didn't have a seat at it but it was connected to our row of tables.
