We waited 10 minutes for the seat while one of our the people in our group stood and talked to everyone. We then asked for another seat again and nothing came for another 5 minutes. We then just took a seat from another patrons table once they said they weren't using it.

 It turns out we were probably better off going to In and Out Burger. The food was "ok" if you ignore the fact that they switched the spice on my dish and gave me 5 stars instead of one and my friend received no stars. After we covered my friends dish in hot sauce I asked for a replacement because they switched the spice. 
 
 The waiter said he would, then asked if I would like some chicken dumplings while I waited and I said that would be great. I then didn't see the waiter for a bit. He finally came by and said he didn't bring my dumplings because I received tofu with my meal, he wasn't sure if I was a vegetarian. Except that I did say I would like chicken dumplings. After he walked away I then motioned for his attention and asked what else I could be compensated with since my meal was still not there and my party was almost done eating. He asked if I wanted a drink, I said yes then I waited 10 more minutes. I then asked the waiter where the drink was and he said he'd check on it. He found the drink at someone else's table. He then remade my drink and instead of a mojito I received an ice syrup drink that was disgusting.
 On top of all of this, my final meal was not all that great. 


 Once we all put our cards in to pay for the waiter, I asked for change or to tell me if we were short cash. He already had an 18% gratuity on the bill. He then returned 5 minutes later and said we were square. I did the math and we were actually over $50 dollars of the owed bill. 

 So, in the end here is what we experienced:

1. Bad service
2. Weak drinks
3. Hard to find seating.
4. Non-responsive staff
5. Bland food
6. Could not get the spice right
7. Did not compensate for mistakes
8. Overcharged and was dishonest

Recent visit for lunch. Service is acceptable. Crab rangoons are okay, not great. Surprisingly the pho is yummy at this thai restaurant. Pricey, but as expected for Vegas! Will try other options next time.
I love this place.  The atmosphere is beautiful and swanky.  The food is excellent. The servers are very nice. Each time the experience has been great.
The pineapple fried rice was good but nothing to write home about. I don't think it stands out from any other Thai restaurant but more expensive. Quiet atmosphere.
The food here is phenomenal! Excellent salmon And duck curry! If you want to test your slice tolerance this is the place to do it! The interior design of this place is just breath

Recently, my husband and I had a coupon for this restaurant.  It is highly overpriced ($5 for a side of rice!), and only average in flavor and variety.  As we were walking down the strip, my husband became violently ill!  He is highly allergic to cashews, and we suspect that a dish we had was contaminated with them.  They could have been part of the chopped "peanuts" that were sprinkled over the Pad Thai.  Rather than return to the restaurant, my primary concern was to get him home, where he was ill for more than 24 hours.  Be careful what you order if you decide to eat here!  Let them be aware of any allergies!

The interior of the restaurant is spectacular. It's very serene and calming. We bought a groupon and it's totally worth it considering the entree prices. We kind of ordered family style so we could try all the dishes we ordered. We made a reservation beforehand and ever seated us away from the main dining area. Our room had a TV in it. Service was good as well even while we were tucked away. 

The rib eye salad was incredible. The dressing matches well with the fresh greens. It had a hint of spice which I really enjoyed which I didn't expect. And the meat was cooked beautifully with lots of flavor while still tender.

The fried calamari was my next favorite. It had a dipping marinara sauce that was kind of sweet... maybe something like honey was added to it. It worked really well with the crispy calamari. Beware of the fried chili pepper because it will be very spicy!!!

The pineapple fried rice was great as well. But I could tell that they didn't use fresh cut pineapple. It seemed like canned pineapple. It was still enjoyable.

The Tom yum soup had lots and lots of seafood. I only wish the base was a bit tangier and spicier. It was a lot for an order of the soup. 

Our table ordered the Pad Thai and the drunken man noodles. I thought they were okay... nothing crazy amazing about them but I still ate them.

The service was good but their food wasn't. I had the duck dish and it tasted really rubbery and dry. 
My husband had the seafood combo and it also tasted rubbery. We both ended up feeling sick the next day.

It is inside the Bally where we were staying! YES awesome! This food was so fricken good. We(7) did family style and ordered about 6 plates of food. Everything was so good and very fast service as well. At the end of it all I paid 33 dollars plus tip for alot of food. I am just fine with that! Just try it for yourself....

Upscale Thai dining. The wait staff was courteous and welcoming. The menu was uncomplicated and we enjoyed everything that we ordered. The drunken noodles were delicious and the seafood salad was perfect for a lighter fare. It was nestled in the heart of Bally's but worth finding.

This place is absolutely amazing and totally worth your time to try! We decided to try it because of a Travelzoo deal and we are happy to report it is one of our new favorite places to dine in Vegas. Nestled inside the Ballys casino, it's a pleasant little space that totally takes you on a tranquility rush. It has dim lighting and a little water fall that you can dine next to. The customer service was excellent which made the entire dining experience a pleasure. And the food was to die for! If you're looking for a good Thai place look no more!

I absolutely love this restaurant. The food is delicious and large portions. Beautiful ambiance, sit by the fountain if you can. William is the best waiter ever. I asked his opinion on what to get and he suggested the spicy soba noodle dish and I just loved it. My husband had the stir fried string bean dish with chicken and that was to die for as well. This was our second visit, on our first visit I had the pad thai which was very good as well. I cant wait to go back again.

What a lovely Thai restaurant in Bally's!  I enjoyed a lovely dinner at a table around the water and really enjoyed the chill atmosphere and simple decor.  I thoroughly enjoyed my dumplings and the Panang curry...beautifully cooked and presented.  Nice escape from your typical Strip restaurants, good service and tasty food!

Located in the Bally's casino, all the way in the back, you can find this small Thai restaurant.  Nicely decorated with a small decorative pool in the middle where you can be seated around it.  The prices are higher than your local Thai place, but what do you expect?  You're in a casino off the strip.  I determine if I like a Thai restaurant by ordering the Chicken Basil, so of course I ordered it.  However, I saw that duck was an option, so I opted with that instead. I was pleased with the results and concluded that I could eat here again.  With so many places in Vegas and this place was in Bally's, I doubt if I return.  If you are in the mood for Thai and in the area, then by all means, come give this place a try.

One of my worst eating experiences in Vegas. The servers are not attentive, never make trips to the table and the food is mediocre at best ( my food was cold, mild when I asked for spicy). Even when I asked the server to make the correction, she screwed up a second time around. 

The drinks are nothing great to write home about either

What can I say about this place. Well first of all, this is an amazing place. My family and I went to this place since all the other restaurants were packed and this was like the only option we could go to. My mother ordered the popular Drunk Man Noodle and my father ordered the Grill Pork Chop, and I ordered the Pad Thai. First of all, the Pad Thai tasted excellent. All I can say is excellent. The taste reminded me of the food in Thailand which gave me a bit of nostalgia. Pad Thai was cooked to perfection. My father said the pork chop was good as well. Grilled perfectly on both sides. According to me mother, she said that the Drunk Man Noodles was better than all Drunk Man Noodles she's ever tried. Better than any Thai restaurant back where she and my father lives in California. Staff was nice of course. Our waitress was Patty. So if your waitress is her, your dining is experience will be AMAZING! Check the place while you can. I bet you will enjoy and never regret going there :)

Considering this is a "high-end" thai restaurant, and I actually enjoyed the food, this place deserved 4 stars. Why did I take 1 star off? Because it tasted like a hole in the wall [to yelper's standards] 5 star restaurant back home at L.A.'s thai town, just fancied up a little. The food was excellent, though, but for the prices were a bit high. Why still the 4 star rating? We came here on New year's eve night. Many of the nicer restaurants had prix fixe menus from $75 up and it was hard to find a nice place without one. I for one am not a fan of prix fixe menus. So we made a reservation here for 8:00 and didn't get seated until 8:30. That was annoying because we even split up our party of 14 just so we can get seated quicker. That clearly didn't work. They have to work on that if you ask me.

The restaurant is dark, and very, very busy. They also don't have a restroom so you'd have to go to the casino floor to use one. It's nicely decorated, but I've eaten at Tao at the Venetian, which is much nicer, and similar in pricing. They also give you chopsticks... uh, they don't use chopsticks in thailand, they use a spoon and a fork. You'd think a restaurant full of Thai workers would know better.

We ordered the phad thai, pineapple fried rice, pad see ew, and bbq pork chop entree. The 4 of us split it and it was all very good. Like I said, it tasted like it does at a popular authentic thai restaurant in l.a., but for twice as much. The service was slow at times, but it was new year's eve and it was a packed house. We always had plenty of water, and the waitress was good about checking on us, but she wasn't spectacular. She did bring my sister's request of chili paste and chili powder really quickly, which was nice.

I wouldn't come back here because I'm sure there's a thai restaurant somewhere off the beaten path in vegas which can make food just as good, and for lower prices. BUT i did have a great experience and was happy with everything we ate.

This place was a nice surprise. We were looking for the steak house next door and Sea caught our eye. The place is small but the ambiance is nice. Wooden booths sit level with the indoor pond. The duck lettuce wraps were tasty and plenitful. We ordered our entrees spicy and they came out with no spice.  I thought thai food was supposed to be spicy to begin with? After sending the food back, it was finished correctly and had plenty of spice. Great taste and more than enough to fill up one person per plate. The service was good. The server was very polite, attentive and knowledgable of the cuisine. The manager even stopped by to check on us a couple of times. The bartender delivered our drinks and was very helpful with suggesting cocktails. Overall, this is a good place for beginners in ethnic food. Not too spicy and great taste with a helpfull staff.
I don't know what was wrong 40 minutes waiting after we order and food never came, and waitress did not show up again neither. Of course we leave.

Don't know why the haters hate. The food here was good, and the only thing to criticize is that the heat is a bit weak 
Order hotter than you normally would. 

Had the spicy basil chicken. Amazing. Opened with the original Tom Ka soup. Great flavor but ordered medium, it lacked heat. 

It is relatively peaceful. Not by most standards, but certainly by Vegas standards. 

Best compliment I can give it is that I'd eat there again.

Overpriced and below average food. Thankfully we got the Groupon. Definitely not the best thai food at its price point (or a even at a lower price point). Look elsewhere for better. 

Here's what my boyfriend and I had:

Appetizers:  These were actually pretty good but can probably get something similar/better in other places.

Tup Tim Fritters (4/5)
Stuffed Crab Rangoons (4/5)

Entrees: Terrible, I ate like a tenth of my pad thai dish and my boyfriend, who will eat just about anything, couldn't finish his volcanic chicken.

Volcanic Chicken (1/5) Entire dish tasted like it was soaked in rubbing alcohol.

Chicken Pad Thai (1.5/5) Just not good. Too dry.

Ambiance: Great, beautiful restaurant. Sucks the food didn't match.

Service: Ok, server wasn't the friendliest.

First, I have to say that I don't understand how a restaurant located inside a casino on the Strip could be so quiet.  My husband and I made reservations for 7p, but there was no need for them - we were immediately sat at a table, one of many that were open.  This place is a hidden gem to be sure!

I tried one of the Vietnamese rice noodle dishes.  Not knowing exactly what it was I had ordered, I was pleasantly surprised with a cold noodle "salad" (I was anticipating a hot dish).  My husband ordered the pad thai and chicken satae (his Thai standards) both were on par with our favorite So.Cal Thai place, so we were very pleased.

Very good and authentic. Everything is full of flavor and came out pipping hot. I can just imagine the big wok and burners they use in the kitchen. Definitely not your Panda Express Americanized Asian food.

Service was nice  and attentive. 

Giving it four stars instead of five due to price. Duck pineapple fried rice was $26! But then again, everything on the Strip is overpriced.
Prompt service. Attentive staff. Tasty food and sauces. They brought out 4 different sauces to taste. We had the pad tai and sweet and sour shrimp. We will return.

FYI: this restaurant closes at 2pm and opens again at 5pm for dinner. Kind of weird...especially since it's located at Bally's casino level...where everything operates 24 hours. Eh..but whatever floats their boat I guess.

Food was delicious. Portions were plentiful. Atmosphere set the mood just right. I really enjoyed sitting next to the pond area with lily pads floating. =) Cute!

Wouldn't go out of my way just to eat here, but if you're around the area or if you're staying at Ballys for your Vegas trip, I highly recommend you checking this place out.

This place is a hidden jewel in the mess of Sin City. Definitely a welcome change from the heat of the weather, noisy beeps of slot machines, and the omnipresent chaos of obnoxious young people. (I'm not going to apologize for what I just said, so deal with it. I will, however, apologize for the obnoxiously rude and annoying ways of my generation which I am regretfully a part of.) On with the review....

Tranquil, quiet, serene. Almost felt like I was stepping into a spa. The decor was lovely. There is a wooden seating area (I don't think it was bamboo) surrounding the fountain, where a large buddha figure greets you at the head. The whole ambience was very relaxing. Definitely something I haven't experienced in Vegas before. 

The food is delicious! We ordered Vietnamese vermicelli bowls, pad thai, green curry (the rice came in a cute little pyramid shape!), and one other scrumptious dish that I can't remember. Probably some variation of fried rice. In any case, all were excellent and robust in flavors. Our waiter was shy and quiet, but very polite and helpful. I think anything we ordered here would have been just as tasty. 

Definitely coming back here again. I especially like that it was open at an odd hour of the day when most restaurants take their siestas (i.e., 3PM) so we didn't have to wait in starvation after hours of working at trade shows. I don't know how they did it, but they really brought some classiness and elegance into Vegas. Thank you, thank you.

.

I had the honey walnut fried rice and basil stir fried tofu. My boyfriend ordered and app, the papaya salad and I found a 2 entree 2 app deal for 49$ on  Groupon... a yelper mentioned it! I scrolled thru Groupon, purchased the deal, ordered another app and saved money on my meal. Thanks yelp! 

The food was delicious and the dessert equally amazing. So happy they honored the deal!
Good food and good friendly services. Definitely coming back when we come back to Vegas since we love the Paris Hotel.

This place is lovely. The food was wonderful too. Whatever crispy walnut shrimp appetizer we had was amazing. I ordered the spicy bbq chicken- they freaking lit it on fire in front of me!! It was so tender, I can't order thai bbq chicken anymore, it just can't compare.

I was so craving for thai foods one night in vegas.
So i found this rest from yelp.
Omg, foods were so tasty, friendly staffs and rest interior looked fancy too.
But price of menu were expensive than you expected..i think compared to other rest in vegas, this prices were reasonable.
I will go back if i had a chance again.

I write this with mixed feelings...dining in Vegas can be complicated...I've always thought of Thai food as delicious and relatively inexpensive. Our party of 4 was there for a celebratory family dinner. We had reservations, although I doubt from the empty tables that we needed them. In our reservations I mentioned our reason for celebrating, but it was never acknowledged. We were seated by the water feature, which is a nice touch. However, there is a bright light that ruins the mood, coming from the kitchen, as well as clanging sounds of dishes getting washed. Additionally, the bus station was about 5 feet from our table. In a restaurant of this attempted caliber, I expect a better ambiance. Both situations could be easily and simply remedied with screens or curtains. Service was almost too good; wait staff kept trying to take away plates that were not yet finished. The food was good, not over the top, not overly generous in portion, but tasty. A party of 4 with 2 beers, 1 soda, and 1 water plus 4 shareable plates added up to $178, with tip. It seems a little pricey, even by Vegas standards.

We had quite a good experience here! The ambiance is really lovely and perfect for a date. If you can, grab a table beside the fountain and throw a couple pennies in for luck.. how fun! Service was friendly and very efficient (we immediately had our drinks refilled without having to ask), and our food arrived quickly. 

I personally really enjoyed the food. The highest praise I can give it is that it's better than your average NYC Thai food. The flavors were perfect and I love how specifically you can control the level of spiciness. I recommend medium, which was ideal for us since we enjoy spicy food but not when it's overwhelmingly hot. The red curry was outstanding, but I also kept dipping rice into my boyfriend's prik king, which was equally delicious. 

My main gripe is with the cost. Firstly, the menu link hasn't been updated with the new prices. You should expect to pay somewhere between $22-$25 dollars for a typical curry, rice, or noodle dish. Sadly, this doesn't even include rice which is $3 extra for a small plate. The quality is obviously better than a cheaper Thai restaurant but it's hard to stomach how overpriced this is for noodles and rice. NYC Thai runs you $10 a dish on average! The portions of the entrees were decent and we left very full, so at least there's that. I would recommend this place if you're not concerned about sticker shock.

My friend and I made reservations to this restaurant for our second night in Vegas. We are both big fans of thai food and I must say that this restaurant did not disappoint. I ordered the iced pomegranate green tea which was unsweetened but I probably could've guessed that prior to ordering. I got the Pad Kee Maow which is the flat noodles which came with egg, onions, bell peppers, tomatoes, basil, and chili. I chose a 3 as a spice level out of 5 (5 being the spiciest). I love flat noodles and this dish was awesome. I would definitely come back and order the same thing again. The atmosphere was great. The restaurant's seating area is sort of divided into 5 sections and some sections more private and others to serve larger groups. I love this place and would definitely recommend it.

Service needs improvement. Ambience is good.  Rice noodles are rehydrated type, at least the two dishes we had.  They were stuck vs loose.  The Tamarind Sea Food Combo was great.  Had to remind them to bring the rice.  Option of white or brown rice.  Thai ice tea was very good, almost no after taste.  I will still go back to try out the more unique dishes.  I doubt I will try the common dishes,  Las Vegas is too expensive to eat what is available in other cities. Considering Las Vegas, prices are on the mid to low.

There weren't many dining choices in Bally's so we decided to try SEA. Ugh, not good.  Cheap wine is way over priced and the food was not very good. I ordered the Drunken Noodles with Chicken and it was bland and sloppy wet. My wife had a seafood bowl that was just as tasteless and looked more like soup than a noodle dish. And if you want rice, better order a bowl or you won't get it. For What it cost to eat here, I'm not impressed.

The food was really good! I'm not a big fan of Thai food...but I likes it. The place was clean and the service was good. The have no liquor license, and the location is odd. The prices were a little steep, and the portions were a little light.

I came here around 11 pm after a recovery nap from day drinking. As you walk in, you're greeted by a stone buddha on top of a pond with floating lotus flowers. The decor is so cute, and the place is dimly lit. They even play good music - telepopmusik vibes. Super chill atmosphere. 

I ordered the spicy seafood noodle soup (medium spicy), which was $22. The portion was huge, and it was loaded with seafood - scallops, shrimp, calamari, fish cakes, and baby octopus. It also had rice noodles, bean sprouts, peanuts, and green onions. Super delish.

My friend got the northern style shrimp tom yum with a side of jasmine rice, and he loved it. I tasted the soup, and it was very lemongrass-y, just the way I like it. My sister got the duck noodle soup, and she liked it, but thought it was a little too heavy. 

The service was also excellent. Our water was always refilled and our waitress brought sauces and explained each one. I would definitely come back the next time I find myself in sin city.

My cousins and I decided to try this restaurant out as it was inside of Bally's and we wanted Thai food. We made reservations. We specifically told them that we have two wheelchair bound individuals and will need extra space. They sat us in the middle of the restaurant with many tables surrounding us. Not giving anyone much room to move around. If someone was sitting behind you-- you could touch their backs. Minus 1 star. While we were waiting for the rest of our party, we had asked for the bill split per table-- they said they would accommodate that. 

As we all placed our orders, the restaurant got a little busier. We slowly started to feel like the waiters were not as attentive as they should have been. When we all got our food, we noticed that several of our dishes were incorrect but with the length of time to get our food most of us just dealt with it. Minus 1 star. I have a food allergy and they did not list what they used as garnish on the dishes. When I received my dish, it had mangoes on it--I am allergic to mangoes, and asked them to cook a new batch. Which they did and the food came out promptly. Minus only 1/2 of a star. 

The food was subpar for the price we paid for it. The best tasting items in my opinion were the appetizers. No one was wowed by any of the mains. Many of the group struggled to eat their food as the found it to be bland or too spicy. They did not ask each individual how spicy they wanted their food. Minus half a star. 

When we asked for the bill, the host and a waiter both said they would get it to us shortly. 15 minutes go by and we still don't have a bill. We finally ask again for a bill and we receive one large bill. Once we received it we notice it was not split the way we asked them to but we're already irritated with the service that we didn't bother. Minus a star. We changed the tip from the automatically charged gratuity as we felt the service did not match what we felt it should be for a "gourmet" restaurant. 

This was honestly the first restaurant via Yelp that a lot of the reviews said it was poor service and subpar food and I actually agreed with it. Sorry Sea, you were not the Thai experience I was expecting.

We went here for daughter's bday.  Decent service, aesthetically the place is ok.  Cool little pond in the middle.  But the food is overpriced, lacking in flavor, and the place is smoky.  Like we smoked a pack as we ate.  Massaman curry is avg. fried rice avg. Rangoon's avg. salmon average.  Pad Thai below avg. Lucky we had a groupon but still way too much $ for very basic food.

I had the SEA noodles with the mixed fish. It was good. The noodles were well prepared, the fish were diced nicely. The sauce had a nice tangy flavor.

They have a nice drink selection.

The ambience of the restaurant is very nice. A fair amount of these restaurants on the strip are way too loud. This place was a nice get away from the noise of the slot machines.

Was not impressed with the food. I barely ate any of the pad Thai. The crab rangoons were pretty good.. But I've had better at other restaurants. Certainly way over priced for the quality of the food.

I was a little saddened that my virgin meal in Vegas was an average Thai experience.  I found the service disorganized--several played hostess, several waited on you, several filled the water glass.  My hostess spoke little English.  It was a tag team of sorts, that I found chaotic in an enchanting room that should bring one peace.  They had fun low-appearing tables around the indoor koi pond but did not even invite me to sit here tho there was open seating.  I think it was being saved for couples--as several of us singles were placed along the sides. 

It took a seriously long time for food to come out.  I ordered Bangkok Panang with Tofu.  It came out with chicken.  But because of the lonnnng wait I did not want to wait again for the correction.  I ate it and did not get even an apology when I told them.  (They were willing to take it back.) I found the restaurant far too dark as well.  When providing a spicy dish one should keep the ice water coming-they had trouble keeping the glass full.  Due to the poor service I skipped dessert.  My bill was still mid $20 with tip--for a dish not quite as good as I can get at home for $10.  This place is not meeting its potential.

Well, yelp nailed this one: "meh" is right. After one too many dinners at a bar, I was craving some Thai, and SEA was close by and reasonably priced. The decor was beautiful, the ambiance was nice, and the glass of Riesling I had was perfect. It went downhill from there. (Speaking of the wine... There is no bar at SEA. So, if you order a drink, be prepared to wait until they fetch it from the abyss.)

We started with a shared appetizer of spring rolls, which tasted like... nothing. I mean, I guess it could have been worse and they tasted bad, right?

Next, our waiter. I got the distinct impression he was making fun of us, like we've ever eaten Thai before. Not cool, dude, not cool. My friend ordered a dish, but asked that, on a scale of 1 to 5 (with 5 being ridic hot), her meal was between a 2 and a 3. I asked for green curry, with a "4." Apparently, this was hilarious. 

The meals finally come out, and.... my friend's dish has NO heat, and if my green curry was a "4" on the heat level, then that's just sad, y'all. I can't remember the last time there were peas and portobello mushrooms in a curry, but it didn't taste bad... Just sad. 

Other than being affordable and pretty, I'd stay away if you're a real fan of Thai.
Food was good but didn't knock my socks off. Wouldn't have eaten here had we not had a groupon. But service was good and ambiance/decor is beautiful.

The first night we ate there we were impressed by the crab rangoon.  It was a nice blend of spicy, scallions and crab.  Some of the best eaten ever.  We also had the Island Red Curry and The Spicy Shrimp Rice.  Was average but the cost was ridiculously high.  $22 per plate and I do not mind paying that in Vegas so the overall experience was good.  The tables are old and chipped, very outdated to justify ambience, food and price but it was down to earth

Because the crab rangoon was so special, we decided to eat there a second night.  And of course started out with the crab rangoon.  The first bite, I thought, this is doughy, like it had been sitting out.  But then I though maybe my taste buds were off since I was so tired.  So I took a second bite and got a ball of ice.  So that means what I thought was so special was either a buy in or made and then frozen or they were going bad so they froze them.  No kidding, you just don't play with seafood like that.  The plate was sent back with forgiveness and the second order came.  Again, frozen.  When you give someone a second chance, there was obviously no pride taken in the cooking that night and we probably just hit it on a day when there was a high note but this seemed standard.  We showed the owner/manager the plate and had him touch the inside.  His face went sour and was so sorry.  I told him I was too but I am not playing when it comes to possible health issues, we were paying for nothing and leaving.  He did not try to make any good will gestures.  It left such a sick feeling in my stomach, we made several attempts to eat in Bally's and just got sicker by the minute.  It ended as a bad eating night and a belly full of hunger.  It was a good thing we had a fresh cupcake in the room.

Would I go there again?  NO!  The risk outweighs the first experience there and could lead me to getting sick.

Our second visit to see the type experience was exceptional. My wife and I both had the softshell crab appetizer and it was great. It's large enough where it could have been the meal. My wife had the sea pot and enjoyed it for a second time. This time I had the duck con feet which was among the best duck I have ever eaten. A little bit on the pricey side but the food is exceptional.

Very good Thai vegetable stir fry's with choice of meets or tofu.

I picked the tofu since I am vegetarian.  Service was fast and very good flavors.  I also got hot tea, very good.  Very nice atmosphere but a bit noisy. (All of Las Vegas is a bit noisy)

Good four stars.

Your average Thai. 
Walnut shrimp: Shrimp cooked well but batter too thick.
Papaya Salad: Good but the papaya sliced too thick.
Spring Rolls: Nothing special.
Green Curry: Very good, only saving grace.
Lava Chicken: Not spicy at all !! Cooked well but nothing volcanic about this.
Drunken Noodles: Good.

This is a nice place. Menu is nice. All entrees were delicious. We dined on a Thursday evening. It was not crowded but the service to the three tables in our area was slow the entire evening. Not simply waiting for a properly prepared entree slow (which we totally don't mind), but slow to the point of each table having to catch any worker passing by and ask for drink refills because our server was missing in action.

sure the food was above average but...do i really have to pay 28dollars for a plate of above average pad see ew...that's more than half the price of a great buffet..no\

at least waters were filled quickly and the waitress was cute though
I'm extremely dislikes this restaurant, all curry is so sweet, so expensive. Not worth it. ????????????????????????????????????20%. ??,???????????????????

If we had stopped eating after our appetizers, I would have given this place 5 stars! Both of our appetizers were off- the - charts yummy!  They have the best crab Rangoon I've ever tasted...and the chili jam added another dimension of great to the plate! We also got the honey walnut shrimp, which was amazing!

Then came the short ribs, which really had an amazing flavor, but they were  dry and there was quite a bit of grissle to cut off.

Next came the holy basil seafood, which had a nice amount of  good seafood and basil in it, but no remarkable flavor. The menu states that it has a spicy basil sauce, but it was not spicy at all. It was very bland.

Also, worth mentioning is that nothing comes with rice. They charge you extra if you want rice, which I found strange, considering that their menu items are pretty pricey to begin with.

All in all, it was a fun evening, since we stopped in to see the dueling piano show on our way out, but I don't think I would make a special trip back there for the food.

We were craving Vietnamese/Thai food tonight.  I wanted to go to eat Pho but there aren't any that are on the strip and the thought of getting a cab at dinner time and then trying to get one back didn't sound pleasant.  

We had been to Ballys earlier in the day and saw that they had a Thai restaurant there.   We looked at the reviews for Sea Thai on Yelp and they were decent.  

We took the monorail back to Ballys from Harrahs and got there around 730.  It wasn't busy  (Wednesday night) so we got a table right away.  They sat us next to the water which was kind of romantic.  The server came promptly and asked us if we wanted drinks. We just got waters because when you are in Vegas why pay for alcohol when you can get it for free when you gamble.

For our meals I had the garlic shrimp and my fianc√© had the pho.  The meals were great.  I was kinda irritated that I got five prawns for 34 bucks and my fianc√©'s bowl of pho was 19 bucks. I mean we had plenty of food, it just seemed expensive for Asian food and that was the reason I didn't want to dine here in the first place.  

My fianc√© said that I have to think about the location of the restaurant, they have to be able to cover the rent.  He also pointed out the decor, most mom and pop pho or Thai restaurants are not decorated as nice.  I guess if you think about going off the strip to have dinner, you have to pay for a cab. Factor that in with your 6 dollar bowl of pho and your 13 dollar seafood dish and you are paying almost the same amount.  Yeah , they are higher priced than your typical Asian restaurant but the food is way better than the Pan Asian place in the food court.
Order Queen of Basil with Chicken. Big portion, it is quiet different than Chicken or Pork with basil leaf original but it is acceptable. Service is lovely, restaurant decor is nice.

We stopped in for lunch and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  We were seated by a water feature with a Buddha statue.  I ordered a lovely jasmine tea along with vegetable spring rolls (with mint & cucumber) and my sister ordered lettuce wraps, then we shared the chicken pad Thai, which was probably the best I've ever had!  Great atmosphere, great food... where the waitress was slow the manager jumped in!  
I will be dreaming of this Pad Thai for a long time to come!
The atmosphere is great romantic setting, every good service and fair price for entrees. I had the drunken man noodle with duck, real good.

Came here for the first time and it was absolutely amazing! The restaurant has a very cool and relaxed vibe! The pond and the statue in the center are absolutely beautiful! Came here with my boyfriend, and we had one of the best dining experiences ever. Our server Jenny was so sweet and very helpful! The manager Anne was extremely attentive and very nice as well! Would highly recommend this to any thai food lover! Will definitely be coming back!

Amazing Thai right in the hotel I was staying at. Great place for a nice date night. I don't think an appropriate place for small children. Service was wonderful, never an empty cup.y table tried four appetizers, all were great!

Food was ok. Extremely pricey for what you get. We ordered curry and it does not come with rice which I've never experienced. Rice always comes with curry. They made us pay extra for rice. There was hardly any chicken in the fried rice and at $22 for fried rice you'd think they would add more than a few pieces of chicken. We had a party of 4 adults and they added 20% tip to the bill without giving us a choice or warning. When we asked them they just said that's the way the computer is. Really. The computers are smarter than you.... I feel completely cheated and robbed of good service, good food, and value for the money paid. $200 later and we will never return. Please beware. I'd go somewhere else and let them know that they are in poor practice of culinary experience and service.

Dumplings, tom kah kai were way too sweet. Prawns in ginger/garlic were fishy tasting. Ambience is nice for a hotel restaurant and service was ok. I would suggest going elsewhere - even with a Groupon the value was not there.

Sea Thai should be renamed Wow Thai. For starters we ordered chicken Satey and chicken & shrimp steam dumplings. For main course we ordered shrimp jungle curry and ginger scallops. None of the main course comes with rice, we have to order that separate. Food was simply fabulous, just right amount of spices. Veggies were real crisp announcing their freshness and scallops were tender and sweet.   Proper service was a major accompaniment.  Ambience was very nice, simplest furniture with modern take. Highly recommended. Little pricey though. I would recommend buying a dinner coupon at Tix4tonight, cost $2 each person for 30% discount on the entire bill.
Just what I needed after staying up all night in Vegas, some bomb spicy papaya salad and spicy red curry with brown rice.  This hit the spot!
Delicious food. Pork rolls are amazing. Green curry dish with shrimp. Yum. I like it spicy. 5. Too hot for most people. Excellent service.

The thai food I tried was decent (Pad Kee Mao, also known as Drunken Noodle), and the crab rangoon's were delicious. It's overpriced for the food, and I have had better Pad Kee Mao. The ambiance was nice, dim, clean, and romantic. I am giving them a rating of 2 stars because the staff gave extremely poor service. The waitress never came to check on us after the food had been served and never gave us refills. We had to ask another staff member for help and for the check, and the place was not busy at all

My husband and I both got curry. He got the red curry and I the panang. The dishes were both very tasty, can't complain about the flavor. However, although the chicken in the center of the dish was hot, the sauce was spread out over a large plate and so was quite cold by the time it reached our table. Also, desert wasn't all that great. We got the golden banana roll, which was somewhat dry. Additionally, it was served with a raspberry sauce, which was incredibly salty! When we asked the server if the raspberry sauce was salted, it turned out she didn't know anything about the dessert at all and went to the kitchen to ask. She returned, saying that the sauce is NOT salted, that the cooks tasted the sauce and said it was fine. This is impossible, as the sauce was saltier than cup-a-noodle soup! I think they may have made a batch with salt instead of sugar. Next time we go, we'll skip dessert!

Very very good! We mainly went here because my sister LOVES Thai food, so naturally we had to find a Thai place. We weren't disappointed! 

I like the layout of the restaurant and the tables that are around the water. The staff was great and the food was very very good!

When you're walking the strip at midnight you can't be too picky, and this place tucked in the back of Bally's definitely exceeded my expectations for a midnight meal.

Good portions, not bad prices for Vegas, modern trendy decor. The set up almost feels like a bench and picnic table around a lake.

Very nice ambiance here. On my first visit was a little date night but I loved the food so much I had my birthday there. There's a private room that you can reserve. Seated 15 of us. Food is tasty and authentic. 
They even have a water feature that goes through the middle of the restaurant. 
Would recommend.

I stayed at MGM and according to my YELP iPhone app, this was the closest place for pho. I needed it to cure my hangover so we went. 

Service: Our server was really friendly. There was one issue: he didn't speak English well. Whenever we asked for something, we had to try to say it again with our hands by pointing to things, making motions, etc. I'm not sure if we were just too much to handle, but I truly think he just didn't understand. At least understand the simple stuff, like red pepper or extra silverware. 

Food: It was aiiight. Definitely not the best pho I ever had. That's okay, that really wasn't the issue. My problem was their lack of condiments. I love having everything in my pho, like all that Asian stuff! Siracha, hoisin sauce, chili pepper, etc. They just didn't really have that at our tables and when asked, our server was clueless. Unfortunately, my pho ended up pretty bland. Maybe this is because this is a Thai restaurant. But please don't charge me $12 for a freaking bowl of pho if you can't perfect it. 

If I ever come back here it wouldn't be for pho. Maybe next time I want pad thai or something I'll try it out again, but that's pretty doubtful.

For a restaurant in Vegas, I was expecting something more over the top.  If this were anywhere else I'm sure I'd have different thoughts, but in the city that never sleeps, this seemed as ordinary as any "Best Thai" in the suburbs.

Alright, the prices are still very Vegas.  My almost $20 pad see ew tasted like many others I have had except it was covered in baby bok choy and adorned with a lemon wedge.  The level 4 spice was more of a three and I was in insane eating beast mode to even really care.

I probably would have never seen this place because it is in the back corner of the casino.  If it were instead some kind of Thai Las Vegas buffet, then it would definitely be worth the trip inside Bally's.  Since it's as ordinary as takeout, I suggest you spend your penny slot winnings at a place you can really gorge at.

It was good, but not Vegas good.

Was craving Thai food but was too lazy to drive the 10 mins to real Thai off the strip. Ultimately regretted that decision and wondered why I didn't listen to the Yelp reviews, which are pretty much spot on in this case. 

Overpriced menu offering mediocre Thai food in a glorified warehouse (maybe I'm exaggerating but that was the feeling I got). Ordered pad thai with prawns, green curry with duck, and something else so tasteless I have unremembered it altogether. 

The service was very friendly, which counts for a lot, but probably wouldn't be enough to make me eat here again. Skip SEA and go to any off-strip Thai restaurant for the real deal. I've been to a few and they never disappoint!
no recommend the pangnan curry, a little bit salty for me, but their lobster is pretty good! i also ordered the combo seafood, but so so~the atmosphere is excellent

Great Service and Great Food!

The head chef from NYC is now in Vegas so the food taste just like at home.

The Pineapple Fried rice was delicious! The Tum Tum Fritters were great! but the Walnut Shrimp AMAZEBALLS!!!

only thing missing are the Sea Wings.. they don't have them in Vegas..

I love Thai food. I love insane amounts of spice so I won't comment on the spice level except to say if you're like me they offer 1-5 and the 5 was mild at best.

The food was good. Not great. Service is great and the atmosphere was comfy.

Be prepared for the prices because ouch - but considering prices on the strip these days I guess that's nothing new anymore.

Very friendly and helpful staff although the place was really quiet at lunchtime. Dumplings in soy sauce and honey walnut prawns made for plentiful and delicious starters. These are very ample portions and entrees are too much for one unless really hungry. The seafood  tart surrounded by a sweet Chile sauce was very good and the spicy seafood soup was excellent.
Not cheap but good food and worth a visit.
One caveat. They don't have Thai beer on the beverage list and could not serve alcohol at lunch time. Very odd.
Delicious. Definitely recommend the Drunken Man Noodles with a side of Peanut Sauce. I've eaten at many Thai Restaurants. This one is exceptional! =D

Our second visit-still so consistent and amazing!
We came here in 2015 and came back again today thanks to the groupon we had! The food was amazing back then and it's still amazing! 
We are vegetarians and this place is one of the best Thai foods we have ever had. 
1. They are open to customizing food for vegetarians(veggie broth, no fish oil etc.), which only very few places are able to do
2. The entree quantity and quality are on point
3. The service is amazing- all the servers are polite and quick
4. The ambience is great- simple and clean

Cons:
The only down point is that if not for the groupon, the place might be a bit too overpriced. 
Their website reports half the prices that are actually mentioned on the menu- seems to be some confusion there.

But will definitely come back if we get another deal/groupon ;)

Small little place inside Ballys.  So cute. The tables are designed next to the pond inside to give you an outside garden feel.  The food was fantastic.  The extra spicy is right on point.  Next time I will not need to order thai spicy as extra spicy for them is hot but you still get all the flavor without the burn.  Well without too much burn.  Will visit again for sure.

We were at a Continuing Legal Education seminar that was being held in Bally's.  We only had a short time for lunch.  We saw SEA and thought it looked like just the thing.  It was.  I had the Drunken Noodles and was very happy.  Great flavors, fresh ingrediants and just the right amount of spice.

I would certainly come back to SEA the next time I am in Vegas.

Thank you.

Solid Thai food in a nice atmosphere. It wasn't very crowded, but still took forever for my water to be refilled.  We tried the Pad Thai and Panang curry.  Both were good.  Overall a nice place in Ballys, I enjoyed it!

The atmosphere wasn't the best, almost nightclub vibe to it, but the food was good.  

I'm a Vietnamese food especially Pho guru.   The pho didn't come with the sate, chili paste, etc so that is a negative.  They did had the sprouts, lime, basil, etc. 

The service was extremely slow for being one of the only ones in there.  I expected better service for $18 for a bowl of Pho.  

I would go back again but expect to wait a little for food.

This little place is tucked away inside Bally's. I didn't go in with very high expectations, but the food was fantastic - perhaps the best Massaman curry I've had. The cocktails were good too. Recommended!

Entertained clients at this Thai restaurant.  Out table for 5 was towards the rear...away from the rest of the patrons.  It was reminiscent to a private dining experience.  The entrees were awesome.  The curries, fried rice, Pad Thai Noodles, appetizers were well prepared.  My only hiccup was not enough attention to beverage refills.  It took longer than expected to have someone come by to refill the beverages.  And considering the dishes were prepared "Medium," our tongues were on fire hence we needed multiple refills.

One word: yes! 
The entrees we ordered were perfect.  We also loved the decor. You really can't go wrong at this restaurant. Highly recommended.

I've always sided with thai more than anything, but this place is fonominal! Highly recommend volcano chicken or Pho for risk takers, or the spare ribs for those who want something simple and delicious. Trendy yet high class, this place is amazing for a night out with the family. Beautiful scenery and great customer service. Statue, fountain, decorative blue candles all in the same place, would highly recommend.

Needless to say I don't give much 2 stars out there.  I came here with high hopes since it seem like a swanky Thai joint.  My buddy and I wasn't really hungry so we shared some dumplings to start and the Siamese Fried Rice.  

Truthfully, in my point of view the dumplings were like Siu Mai from dim sum.  It had a good pork flavor, but the soy sauce it was sitting on was over salty.  I would start by changing the dumplings since it really wasn't in my viewpoint.  As for the sauce place it on the side and some spice needed.  The Fried Rice was nothing spectacular.  Rice that's fried with dried chicken.  I'm surprised they didn't ask me for the spice level!?  Needless to say, I was highly disappointed.  

I would say service was good and so was the ambiance.  However, I'll walk to a new Thai joint next time around. - Enjoy!

Service was great, we went for dinner before a show.  We were about 20 minutes early for our reservation and were seated no problem.  I ordered the Spice Soba with chicken, it was awesome.  I will refer people to visit this restaurant.

Took me 4 days to figure this out. 

I ended up going to multiple places for food and having to throw away what I could only partially eat. 

Much better price/healthy options @the SEA than anything on the strip. 

Brown rice + steamed veggies at $15.00 with much larger portion sizes than what you can get at Pan Express in the Bally's food court. I cheated and got an order of the coconut spring rolls and used the delicious lime dipping sauce for my steamed veggies. 

Need a detox after 3 days of Rao's/Joe's/Morimoto's. Steamed veggies have no oil and no salt. Can add salt via the provided hot sauce. Reasonable price at $10. Couldn't finish the portion size. 

They have Vietnamese menu in addition to a Thai menu. The vietnamese noodle soups aren't as salty as the Chinese Beef Noodle soups. 

Thank You SEA for listening to customers and being reasonably priced so as to not being insulting. And thank you for not trying to trick me to maximize profit!!!!!!!

I have to start off by saying that this is not a traditional Thai food place.  They have a very interesting spin on their Thai dishes.  But surprisingly, it works out well.  We enjoyed everything we ordered.  The lettuce wrap was ok, not my favorite but not bad.  Chicken satay was tasty and not dried out.  Shrimp & walnut was definitely not what we expected but really good!  It was battered & fried but really light & crispy yumminess.  And then there was the drunken noodles with shrimp, spicy and delish!!!  We did have 1 person that hates anything Asian, so she ordered the ribeye steak, for $42 it had better be good, and it was.  She said it was perfectly cooked and seasoned but she hated the ginger sauce that it came with.  I did try it and agreed with her.  Thanks for our Groupon, our meal didn't dent us too bad in our pockets, and we were told we're allowed 2 Groupons per table!  That's awesome!  Service was 5 stars!!  Very sweet server and attentive!  And the place is just beautiful with the water feature in the center of the restaurant.  I'll be back!

This place should get a good review just for the pomegranate mojito alone. Holy. Freaking. Delicious. It was another really late night in Vegas, we took a cab back from old Vegas and decided to have them drop us off at a random spot on the strip to find some dinner. It was close to midnight but Sea was open and there was a decent crowd in there still. The decor is beautiful and tranquil, much needed, especially after spending the evening in old Vegas. The service was quick and pleasant and the suggestion for me to try the pomegranate mojito was perfect. The menu was a little confusing at first until I realized one side is the Thai side and the other is the Vietnamese side. For dinner I had spicy noodles with chicken. It was OK. I asked for medium spice level but it really tasted like there was not spice at all. I was in the mood for something spicy so that was a little disappointing. The prices weren't bad at all and I left with a satisfied belly.

The Thai experience you do not want. Food is not good, lighting is poor (I swear I was blind for my whole meal cause of flickering lights), our server spoke Chinese much better than English, which was fine for my Chinese speaking friends and family but I can imagine it can be difficult for other parties. Overpriced, I know Vegas is expensive but this doesn't even taste good so yes, overpriced af. 
Maybe I came here on a bad night, but I don't think I'll return next time I go to Vegas. 
I'm giving a star to the not horrible service (but also nothing to rave about), cute water pool thing in the middle and the cute hanging chair at the entrance.

Excellent and attentive service. My husband and I both had the Shrimp Pad Thai for lunch. He liked his and thought it had great flavor, but I didn't feel the same and I can't pin point why. I love Thai dishes and went with a basic but felt it wasn't fresh in flavor.

Great food and amazing customer service!!!! 
Manager "O" was very attentive and took the time to help me find the perfect meal. Came and checked on our meals when they were served. Will definitely come back!

The decoration inside the restaurant was nice but unfortunately, the strong cigarette smell from the casino permeates in and ruins the dining experience. The food was ok and certainty wasn't worth the price. Disappointed.

We went here as part of a Groupon promotion, it was good value with the voucher. Food and service was quick, I did find it interesting that they added all means up together then put the voucher in as the value and we were still required to pay tax and then tip, it just seemed interesting that the charges the tax on the whole value because we had not come across that before. Taking that into account it was pretty expensive, was happy with food and service but probably won't be back because of the price.!

I love the atmosphere and the ragoons and that sauce was delicious . The cashew
Chicken was fantastic but the fried rice had huge vegetables including giant raw onions and tomato. I was not happy and it took time to get the main entree . Not sure why ... they weren't chopping any veggies or cooking them.  The Thai iced tea was delicious.

So, we(my fiance and I) walked from Harrah's Casino to Bally's to eat here. So when we got there at 4:30pm there was a sign that it will reopen at 5pm so we decide to walk the casino and look for a place that we can order him a burger since he rarely eat asian food. We placed a togo order for him and walked back to Sea Thai. So we get back at 5pm they seat us and came took my drink order. We were there before the other parties but the wAitress decide to tAke their orders first then came to us like 10 mins later to take my order. She asked me if I would like the New Years Eve Dinner Special for $45 I said ok. I asked my fiance a question about the food and the waitress says to me
Rudely..."HE CANNOT TOUCH YOUR FOOD HE HAS TO ORDER HIS OWN!!! WE DONT DO SHARING IN HERE!!!  I was like wow. She says I wouldn't be able to eat there if he wasnt eating. Wow!! She then advise me to order it to go. I told her I was planning to eat there while we were waiting for his togo order. She took the menu from us said sorry and walked off. I have never been so angry in my life! I did not want to cause a scene because There were people in there trying to enjoy their dinner. I can't tell you how the food was but my waitress ruined my dinner!!!! I guess they get so many tourist that they don't care about losing any.  I wont be back.
Excellent food, good service and nice atmosphere! Very well priced for Vegas! Must try the drunken noodles!

We used Groupon $40 for 2 appetizers and 2 entree's, lot of food!
We shared the SEA Caesar salad and Tom Ka soup. Both excellent. Soup with coconut milk base was very flavorful and loaded with chicken. The salad had crunchy wonton strips and a light tasty dressing.
I ordered the cashew stir fry with shrimp. Great variety of fresh veggies, about 8 good sized shrimp and loved the brown gravy.
My husband ordered Massaman Curry with beef, he really enjoyed it. Loaded with beef strips and sweet potato that he thought was cooked perfectly.
The service was top notch as well, our iced tea glasses were never empty.
Would definitely recommend, but could be pricey without the Groupon.

My girlfriend and I ended up here after I bought a groupon and we were both surprised at how good the food was and everything we had was excellent and just the best flavors and cooked to perfection. We had a seat next to the water and the Buddha and it was a little loud but the atmosphere and the food were beyond our expectations and will be going back.

So my experience here was in my book...5 stars.
The service was super friendly, and the food was excellent! Sure it's pricey, but SO WHAT, your in Las Vegas- that's to be expected. I either put the extra $10 bucks towards a delicious meal or give it to a slot and get nothing in return. For me, it's as simple as that

Loved my experience at the Thai experience ! :)
This was my last meal before heading out of Vegas and it was fab. Lip smacking spicy food, beautiful ambience and absolutely friendly service. 
Thumbs up: pretty much everything we ordered :-D Thai iced tea (believe me there are tons of places that mess up something as simple as Thai ice tea), jungle chicken, Thai Basil fried rice.

The pad thai was a little below my expectation.  I was missing a hint of flavor. To all the Thai food craving gang you got to visit this place!
Quite good. Expensive but so is everything in Vegas so I would definitely recommend it. Got the drunken noodle with chicken and house Red wine.

Staff was very friendly a little hard to understand with a language barrier. Have a Groupon for 2 Apps ($14 ea) and 2 Entrees ($25/ea) we ordered the Calamari App and Tim Tom(burnt) App. Surprise no Entree for$25 so you either pay more or lose the difference. The food isn't any better then anywhere else we've been. I hope they find a way to improve, I won't be back.

The green curry was VERY good! 
The setting is quiet, peaceful, a perfect break from the Vegas madness. 
I would definitely to back!

Purchased a groupon online. (Remember to tip on the full value of the dinner.) The staff were friendly and honored it. Appetizers were a generous size. My boyfriend and I ordered two appetizers and two entrees and found it more than enough food. The flavors were a pleasant Asian fusion style. The decor was very zen. We were seated at a table along the fountain in the center of the restaurant. They had floating lanterns and lotuses on the water.  Very nice place to bring a date!

We used the Groupon for two people, which with a 20% coupon ended up costing $39 for $78 worth of food. We made a same-day reservation and had a seat next to the pond. We both thought the restaurant was beautiful. Our server was very attentive and always within sight if we needed something. 

My husband got the panang curry and loved it. I had the chicken pad thai and also loved that. I'm not sure if we went on a better night than some of the other reviewers, but my husband and I were both thrilled with the experience. We did not order drinks so cannot speak to those.

We are heading back to Vegas in September and just purchased another Groupon for this restaurant. Looking forward to it hopefully living up to the first experience.

Yelp says they are open now but they are closed. 3:30 PM on Thursday 7-27-17.
We returned the next day for dinner. Chicken Pad Se Ew. Sorry, not much flavor. Bites of chicken the size of raisins. The fresh salad  rolls were different than what I  am used to but they were very flavorful. Very expensive for what you get. I know everything in Vegas is overpriced for what you get but you would think they would at least try.

Pretty bitchin seating area! Came here for lunch on our last day and it was delicious. My boyfriend had the geyser prawns and I had a peanut soy noodle. We both got appetizers to share, ginger calamari and chicken lettuce wraps. We also ordered a pitcher of green tea and it was some of the best green tea I've had. It tasted so fresh.
Food is excellent... although the service is a bit awkward... just a vibe we got.
Great food! The walnut ginger shrimp were very good!!! The service was good. I am one happy camper. I dont have anything that i would change (that's saying a lot).
I had the roasted duck drunken noodles, spice level 3/5. It was very good. If you are in or near Bally's and want Thai food do not hesitate to visit this restaurant.
The food was delicious  The service was great and the atmosphere was perfect for my small family birthday celebration

I love SEA Brooklyn, I hate SEA Manhattan. My level affection is based --absolutely-- on their Po-Pia Sod (Vegetable Summer Roll): Brooklyn's are fresh and vicious. Manhattan's are dry and sad. But when it comes to Vegas, there are no Po-Pia Sods on which to base my entire review on! Instead I had to order the boringly named Crispy Spring Rolls with lime and mustard vinaigrette. 

The rolls: Good! Not special, but good!

The dipping sauce: OMG AMAZING! Super tart and sweet, littered with aromatic mustard seeds! Did I slurp it directly from the shallow bowl after I finished my rolls?! Only I (and my dining companion... and waiter) know for sure.

The restaurant looks like a tiny knock off of the Brooklyn location. Which is appropriate since my opinion of the Vegas branch is akin to the beloved North 6th outpost! But, unlike the bougie Brooklyn location, this place is never crowded... at least not yet!

I give 5 stars mostly for the service, prices, and ambiance. I ordered the Pad Kee Maow (I think that's how it's spelt?), it's always a favorite of mine. Here it was only ok. Everything on the dish was great, except that there was hardly any sauce so it was pretty dry. I think because I ordered it "mild", and I guess different places have different views on how hot that is, so here mild is no sauce no spicyness.
We have had pad thai, drunken noodles, marinated steak, and spare ribs here. Noodle dishes were better than the meat dishes but all around a good meal.

If I were rating this on food alone, I'd give it 4 stars. Definitely one of the best options in either Bally's or Paris LV, and genuinely tasty food. If you ask for very spicy, you indeed will get very spicy.

I had an excellent tom ka soup - thicker than most, and very satisfying. Drunken noodles for the main course, which were typical but not exceptional. A second visit included fish cake appetizers that were nicely crisp on the outside but tender and very flavorful.

*However*, like so many places in Vegas, the service is somehow both friendly and incompetent. Many of the staff speak English so poorly that you cannot be assured you will get what you want. On my first visit, I ordered spice level '3' and instead got a '5', which significantly changes the experience. My dining companion also ordered '3' and got about a '2'. The actual spice level is irrelevant - the point is we ordered the same thing and got wildly different results.

On the second visit, our dinners simply did not materialize at all. We watched for 45 minutes while diners arrived, were seated, and began to eat. No food. We spoke to our waiter, then another (since ours was not very fluent with English), and got several reassurances. We had indicated that we needed to depart at a certain time, and were again reassured. But that time arrived and still our dinner was "a few minutes" away. In the end, we had to leave without eating it at all! We got one curt "sorry" and that was it.

I don't know (or care) whether that was a communication problem, a kitchen problem, or a management problem. Likely several at once. But the result was a *serious* problem for any restaurant. Beware.

Let me start with the pro's the service is great. Everyone that works there is very nice. The first word that comes to mind after leaving this place is overpriced. Never have we ever paid 80 dollars for 2 entrees and an appetizer at a Thai food place.  With no drinks !!  I understand that it is vegas and that it is in Bally's which can explain the price. The fritters were very good. However, I absolutely hated my entree. I ordered the pineapple/ginger saut√©ed chicken dish. It did not come with rice, rice was a extra charge (which is a 1st for us). I couldn't enjoy the dish because the taste of ginger was sooooo overwhelming. I didn't want to bother attempting to order something else so I literally just picked at it.  The 2 entrees and appetizer came up to 70 dollars which was Just insane to me. Add in tip for a meal that I didn't enjoy 80 bucks. We have a sea Thai nyc in Brooklyn. I thought it would have been similar or affiliated , but I don't think it is.

Solid food.

Like the rest of the Strip they try too hard with the decor and then charge you an arm and a leg.

The food was good but I would only rate it as okay compared to other Thai resturants I have eaten at.  The service was very slow.  I do not think they had enough help. Our server was trying hard but had too many tables to wait on.

The Thai Experience? Hmm. I think not. I think it is a little pan-Asian-Americanized. I also think it is the wallet-emptying experience, unnecessarily so. 

I had the prik king (~$28) which was not what I would call generously sized. I ordered it "Thai spicy" and I wouldn't even say it had a kick. I wanted a glass of green tea, but it is only served by the pitcher ... at $10. Food was mediocre. 

I was also sat behind the screen, which is where they seem to sit people they want out of view. The lighting back there is harsh and is right next to the kitchen. The vibe is entirely different there. I was dining alone and I guess that marked me as an undesirable one that had to be seated away from the many empty tables out front. Also back there was a group of 80+ year olds and later a Middle Eastern couple that eventually asked to be moved to the front (maybe they didn't like being sat next to the single guy). 

There are better Thai options on the Strip and even better off the strip. Save your dough.

Stayed at Bally's and came here on a Wednesday night. No wait around 6pm. We had the crab Rangoon and the fritters for appetizer. Both were amazing! Then had the spicy Thai fried rice and Pad See ew for dinner (Groupon). Both were decent. Had better but the service was good and no wait on the food. Even my 9 year old was happy!

We had a very nice experience here for dinner!

It was date night and my hottie brought me here for din din. We got a Groupon Voucher to suit our budget. Made a reservation on Opentable and was seated right away when we got there. The interior decor of the restaurant was amazing, very zen with a small koi pond, and floating lotus flowers. There was a small bamboo swing and buddha statues situated throughout the restaurant. The whole feel was very tranquil and peaceful. 

Our waitress was very nice and explained some of the specials to us. We ordered 2 dishes to share, the prices are a bit expensive but it's to be expected for a high end place on the strip. The food was pretty good, and the service was attentive. I really just like the whole vibe of this place. 

Bathrooms are outside of the restaurant in the casino. It's bit of a walk to the restaurant from the parking structure. Overall, I would recommend this place!

Food is absolutely delicious but the price you pay is a little silly. I got curry and had to pay extra ($6!) for the rice...was I going to eat it like soup?! The service isn't very friendly either, but the ambiance is romantic and soothing. It's a 50/50, but we'll never got there again.
Really good thai food! I had the seafood Rad Na and hubby had grilled chicken and chicken fried rice. Their portions are quite worth the price. Too bad I have to wait a year to try this place again!

Great food, ambiance, and service. Ordered the short ribs, which were really good! I was expecting a few "racks" and got about 7, so my only complaint is that was too much great food to eat!  Would definitely go back.

In my humble opinion, this is one of the best Thai restaurants this side of the Rockies... I ordered my favorite dish Pad Kee Mao and was not disappointed.
The spicy thin sauce covered the thick egg noodles and just al dente (can you use an Italian word when describing Thai food?) fresh vegetables sang in my mouth.
I ordered veggie egg rolls encrusted with toasty coconut as a starter. These little delicacies were served in a sea of sweet, slightly lemon sauce.
It is a beautifully decorated place with special touches of design. It is tucked out of the way at the back of the Bally's Casino. Worth the walk through the slot machines!
While the food and the service were good, the restaurant smelled bad and I was unable to get Thai beer because they had to get beer from outside the restaurant (it was weird).

Was really hoping for amazing food and left feeling just either way about it. Ordered miso soup, and the pad thai. Both were appetizing but nothing too special. I did get their sweet mango coconut rice for dessert, and that was very delicious. Don't think I would go back just because there are so many other options in Vegas to explore.
Great food at semi-reasonable prices for Vegas. Generous portion of veggies. Everything freshly prepared. Brown rice available. Great choice for a healthier meal. Eat in or to go.

We're huge fans of the SEA in Brooklyn. They've transported the hanging chairs, rectangular pond, the statue, the caged area, the wood accents, and menu to Vegas now. No deejay, though, at least on weekdays.

Prices are much higher (about twice as much) and service is slower (even though the place is a third the size of Brooklyn's). The entrees were $16 - $18/each.

Their menu is Vietnamese on one side and Thai on the other. Ingredients are fresh and dishes are well-balanced. Good-sized portions and the kitchen is good with custom orders. Stand-out dishes are the drunken noodles, pad thai, and pineapple fried rice.

Unfortunately, the smoky smoky smoky air brought this from a 4-star down to a 3. The water also tasted chlorine-y, which should bring this down to a 2.5, except that the servers are extra-courteous (e.g., rushing to get a to-go cup so I could bring my iced coffee with me when I left).
An excellent, highly authentic Thai restaurant on the Strip. What a surprising treat. The Pad Thai and Pad Woon Sen were incredible.

The food at SEA is definitely good.  I don't know if it really is worth the price you pay for it though.  I never thought I'd pay $16 for Pad See Eiw ever.  Most Thai places only charge about $8, and in Thailand $1.50.  Seems like an overpriced Thai restaurant to me, kind of like P.F. Chang's is to Chinese restaurants.  In any case, the food here is delicious, price may not be a deterrent if lady luck is rolling with you in Las Vegas.

The decor of this place is surprisingly trendy, especially since it's located inside an older Bally's casino.  There are nice tables beside a pool of water that centerpieces a nice Buddha statue.  Pretty cool for a Buddhist, like myself, to see such a remembrance of belief.  The restaurant looks very much like a few Sukhumvit restaurants and lounges I've gone to in Bangkok.  The bubble seats, in particular, that hang from a ceiling mount at the entrance reminded me of the trendy & cool Bangkok nightlife.  Personally, I just like sitting on them.

My family and I ordered:

Pad See Eiw w/ Chicken - $16
Chicken Wing Lollipops - $9
Green Curry w/ Chicken - $17
Queen of Thai Basil w/ Beef - $16
Tamarind Whole Fish (tilapia) - $32

Everything tasted great.  Even, what I thought, was an overpriced Pad See Eiw had my mouth drooling for more.  The tamarind-chili sauce from the tilapia was exceptionally tasty.  I poured a lot of that saucy goodness all over my white rice.  Combining the sauce to an already aromatic jasmine rice made it even better.

A note of warning though, SEA charges 20% gratuity for parties of 5 or more.  I didn't really like that since I thought the service was mediocre at best.  Fifteen percent would have sufficed since our waters were not refilled even once.  And, I'll be damned if I order another $5 Thai Ice Tea.  Anyways, I'll come here again if the dice are rolling my way or if I want to bring a date to a nice looking restaurant, otherwise I prefer to go to a more reasonably priced Thai restaurant on Spring Mountain Road that's just as good.

Stumbled upon this brand new restaurant adjacent to Bally's Steakhouse this past weekend.  What a hidden gem in the land of overpriced strip food.  Feeling slightly under the weather, we ordered a bowl of pho. The chef must have been tutored personally by ramen girl's soup nazi because they have got this down to perfection.  The vietnamese spring rolls are also some of the best I've had.  Only disappointment was the pad thai which was swimming in too much sweet sauce.  But the prices more than make up for the one dish not too our liking.  The dishes are reasonably priced by Vegas Strip standards.  We ordered 2 dishes, an appetizer and a bottle of Sonoma Cutrer and the bill was under $100.

The ambience is cool with comfortable wooden booths next to a water pond. The service is exceptional  When the word gets out about this restaurant, it will be crowded because there aren't a ton of tables.   If you find yourself on this side of the strip, definitely seek out Sea.

Definitely not the best Thai food I've had.  The appetizers were great, and portions were large here, but I thought my entree: Pad Thai was lacking flavor.  I would go back though, for the appetizers!! I had the steamed dumplings which were delicious!!

We were vacationing in Vegas, and had a craving for Thai food.  This was pretty close to where we were staying so we tried it out for lunch.  I would say the food was delicious.  We really enjoyed it.  The only reason it doesn't get more stars is the service.  We ordered appetizers, and the main meal came out first.  We also felt the service was not so attentive.  It wasn't really that busy when we got there, and though it picked up a little bit later, I don't think they really came around to see how we were doing,  if we needed anything else.  Also, it was quite expensive (for Thai food), but the ambience and environment were nicer than other places we go for Thai, so that's the tradeoff.
Very good, incredible atmosphere and massuman curry was great.  But lets be honest, this is mislabeled.  Definitely a $$$, not $$.

We came here for lunch with a group of 9 for a friend's bachelorette weekend because of a Groupon deal - 2 appetizers ($14) and 2 entrees ($25) for $47. This made the prices OK, but the original prices are definitely on the high end. The decor was nice with a pool inside, and the place was rather small and intimate. 

We all enjoyed our appetizers and meals, but not the best Thai I've ever had. Crab rangoon was on the sweet side, dumplings were good, four season rolls were nice and fresh. The spice level varies depending on what you get. The pad Thai level 4 was pretty mild, while the spicy green curry level 4 was definitely on the way to a legit Thai hot level 5. The portion sizes are very generous and we all ended up taking leftovers home. I would recommend this place with the Groupon, but not without.
Foods are great.  People are very friendly. Every time we go to Vegas this restaurant is always my first choice

This was definitely the best meal we had in Bally's hotel! The garlic butter shrimp and crab claws were AMAZING.  My daughter also said it was the best teriyaki chicken she's ever had! I enjoyed a delicious cocktail called a cobbler.  
One con is that rice does not come with many of the dishes.  I was charged $9 for a small portion of rice. 
Great ambiance.  Eat near the pond.

Located inside Bally's. First time eating here and it was fabulous. The service was great and the ambiance is nice. We had the pad Thai and sobo noodles. Spiciness was perfect and the food was full of flavor. If you are in Bally's I would recommend giving it a try.
A MUST TRY....the food is delicious, and the staff is amazing. Can't wait to go back to Vegas just to eat this.
Amazing food the prawns where so fresh and delicious and the atmosphere was beautiful. My mouth is watering thinking of the dinner we had! Would recommend to anyone visiting vegas

Wish I could have tried the food to rate accordingly. Unfortunately for me, I chose to drive down and walk through Bally's to be turned away an hour before closing because "it was slow." How 'bout you post closing times earlier and stay open if you're busy. Way better, late-night, thai food across the street at Thai St Cafe anyway.

This was one of my favourite dining experiences of our Vegas vacation. Aw heck, one of my favourite dining experiences ever!

The ambiance and decor are spectacular. Hidden away off a corner of a busy, loud casino, this tranquil, calm, quiet oasis makes you feel as though you've stepped into another world. The still pond is lovely. The tables are comfortable. The entire place is lovely. 

The service here is fantastic and attentive. We were seated immediately. Menu questions were answered thoughtfully. We were checked on regularly but unobtrusively. Everyone quietly ensured we had a wonderful experience. 

The food?  Oh. My. God. 

I didn't know that the curry we ordered was on CNNs top ten restaurant dishes anywhere til later, but yes, yes it deserved that distinction. Our table ordered a few dishes to share and everything we tried was simply phenomenal. 

I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough. A perfect experience start to finish.
A bit pricey, but I love the ambiance here.  There location is pretty bad and easy to miss but if your on the stip and especially staying at Bally's make this a place to not miss.

This is place is grossly overpriced for the quality/ taste you receive.  I have never paid more than $15/ entree for Thai food so when they charge $22-28 a platter, I was expecting some stellar, grade A stuff.  It was very bland.   Seriously not worth the money.  Thank God I had a Groupon but even paying 50% off it was still not worth it.  

Never order the Holy Basil Seafood Platter.  Basically boiled Seafood.  We ordered:

Crab Rangoons - Ok, Pick up Stix caliber
Chicken Satae - Ehh
Chicken lettuce wraps - blah
Calamari - Very generic, nothing special

Chicken Cashew - YUM
Holy Basil Seafood - NO GO.  So bland
Sweet Potato Curry - Gross
Ribeye Steak Salad - YUM, very spicy
Drunken Man's Noodles - Good
Thai Iced Tea - Good

Service was EXCELLENT.   Drinks refilled. Seated Timely.  Food came out quick. Just the food itself wasn't great.
Amazing food! Drunken noodles were amazing! Go to a half price tix booth and get 30% off

Overpriced, mediocre, terrible service.

Don't waste your money.  There were 2 other tables there when we were seated so they weren't busy at all.  We ended up waited more than 30 minutes for our food and they didn't even offer water.  

I asked for mild pineapple fried rice and there were A TON of whole/half thai chilis mixed in (which are EXTREMELY spicy).  They also used a lot of pepper.  Overall, my pineapple fried rice wasn't anything special and definitely spicier than I would have liked.
