Expect to pay about $16/entree, which is double the price anywhere else for the same thing (might even taste better at the cheaper restaurants).  Our bill was a little over $50 (not including tip) for 2 entrees and 2 alcoholic drinks.  For that price, you might as well save it for The Buffet at Bellagio across the street.

We visited SEA during our last trip to Vegas solely because I'd bought a voucher on Travelzoo for a $45 dinner for two. This turned out to be about the best purchase I've ever made. Our meal was excellent, the service was good and the ambiance was excellent. We were lucky enough to be seated near the back and you could almost forget that you were in a casino.

Our appetizers - coconut crusted shrimp and crab rangoon - were delicious. Similarly, our entrees (macademia crusted salmon, which I highly recommend, and a daily special calamari pad thai) were very flavorful and the portions were huge. My only disappointment was the dessert, a coconut ice cream sandwich that I found to be a little lacking.

This place had probably the best Thai food I've eaten in Las Vegas. I'll be back.

WOW! The best Thai food I have ever had! The Volcano Chicken was delicious! The Drunken Noodles, were like none other! I cannot wait to come back! The staff was super attentive...never had an empty glass of tea. If you are looking for a new Thai food experience, this place is a must to try!! You'll thank me later!
Very good service; nice selection. Had the Pad Thai chicken and it was very good. Nice texture to the rice noodles; tender chicken; spices on request.

I was surprised by the 3.5 ratings. I am thinking the spice level is what people are not liking. The food quality was great, excellent authentic flavors which were on the high spicy side. The place has great ambiance as well.

I was skeptical, as I eat a lot of Thai food... a lot, but I was pleasantly surprised!  The staff are all super friendly from the moment that they greet you at the door until you leave. The food is very good! I had black noodles  (pad see ewe) and they were great! That is saying something,  because I am picky. My husband's drunken noodles wete also great. 

My only complaint is the price. I order Pad see ewe all the time.  It usually ranges between  $7-$12, depending on where you are. When we got our receipt,  we were floored. It was $21 per plate! That is a ridiculous amount. I'd give 5 stars if the price weren't so high, in fact, I may change my rate to a 3, because the price was that astronomical. It was no different from great Thai food in my neighborhood,  even the higher end restaurants. Why, then, did I pay double?

Average thai food at an expensive price. The decor and ambience of the restaurant was the most appealing part of our experience here. We ordered the grilled chopped chicken lettuce wrap for appetizer, which was average in taste. We then ordered the volcano chicken for the entr√©e. According to description on the menu, the dish is supposed to made using spicy sauce, however the dish was sweet! We couldn't taste the spice at all! It was so difficult to eat sweet, bland chicken. Overall a disappointing experience and a big hole in my wallet.

So, with respect to my previous review something changed for the better. The ambience of the place remained nice, and other things improved. earn it its lonely star. Service was okay if a bit slow, drink menu still had nothing really Thai to offer, but the menu itself was improved and my pad Thai reasonable even if not excellent.

The prices are still high for the quality IMO

Went here w/my wife on a recommendation from a friend. Fantastic Thai restaurant. I loved the little coy pond in the middle. I didn't even know my main course was soup-style, but it was very good. Perfect mix of everything I love: Shrimp, mussels, octopus, so good. Perfect Thai Iced Tea too. Would definitely go back.

Pretty crappy. My husband was excited to go here because he passed a poster for it. We went before seeing a show. The decor is pretty and relaxing and the seats by the pond are really nice. It was quite beautiful until straw wrappers started floating by. We got the honey walnut shrimp appetizer and all I can say is it defiantly was not honey walnut shrimp. It was something spicy and terrible. Both of our meals weren't any good and the server was extremely slow. We had to get other servers to help at times. I got a Thai Iced Tea that was disgusting. I took one sip of it and left it sitting on the table. The server never asked about it just sitting there. Our bill was well over $100 and we walked away hungry and disappointed. Get off the strip and don't go here. Total letdown. One star for decor.
Very expensive to the tune of about $40/person by the time you're done. However the plates were huge. There were 8 of us and every dish was delicious. Service was excellent.
Delicious, authentic Thai food. Top notch service. Highly recommend. If you are a Thai fan...don't miss this experience!!! Atmosphere and dinner were just so on spot! Loved it!!!

Loved the Brooklyn location so was happy to see one here. Much more intimate than the original location but food was just as great as I remembered. This restaurant, like many in Sin City, was tucked in the back of a casino. I'm not a gambler, so no temptation there. Unfortunately you will have to contend with cigarette and cigar smoke on the way there, but inside the restaurant itself, no issue. Meal was great, servers were friendly and I thought the prices were reasonable.

A little place squirreled away near the Paris / Bally's crossover.  Seek it out and you will be rewarded!

The decor is beautiful and is more effective if you're there early.  The candles, water, and subdued ambiance are quite effective in combination.

The food is a win in every way.  Portions are on the large side, well prepared, and delicious!

I started off with the summer rolls from the Vietnamese side of the menu.  They were very well prepared; fresh and crispy, with grilled pork, mint, and rice noodles inside.

I had the Drunken Man's Noodles for the entr√©e - they were flavorful, spicy, and full of meat and vegetables.  I can highly recommend this dish - have them spice it the way you like it; it's a real crowd pleaser.

When all was said and done, it was about $31 with drinks ($5 for a big thai iced tea).  That's pretty cheap for Vegas.

OH man, perhaps it's because I went to Thailand for 3 weeks this summer and I'm spoiled, but this just was not good.  It wasn't even good for cheap Thai and it was PRICEY.  
I got the Drunken Noodles and they were a sticky, gooey mess.  The portion was teeny and at $25  I wish I had more.  

The ambiance is dark and quiet and it's quite hard to see the menu.

I got a table by the water it was great.  We both had the seafood salad. It was great. I loved all the different seafood and vegetables in it.

Mine was a little too spicy but that was my fault.

The service was very attentive.  We will go back.

This was definitely a hidden gem.  We had tickets to see Jubilee and wanted to do dinner before hand at Bally's.  Thought SEA would be a great change from what we are schedule to eat during the rest of our trip.  It is way it the back corner of the casino by BLTsteak.  Nice quite and tucked in.  Beautiful interior, with a central water feature.

2 minor issues.  This is a pricey restaurant so I would not expect for them to have the cheapest, crappiest chopsticks I've ever used.  My thai restaurant at home has significantly nicer sticks and the dishes are half the price.  Really no excuse for short cheap wood that don't separate.  A place this nice should have beautiful sticks.  The other is that we order a pitcher of tea and the "pitcher" is a tuberwear jug.  With the label on it.  Again where is the class.  I can see beautiful teapots on the other table but I have a $2 plastic jug. Mind you the tea was pored into wine glasses but really.

Ok onto the greatness...the food. Before appetizers we did the crab Rangoon and the honey walnut shrimp.  The Rangoon was good, what made it great was the sauce.  At first my dad thought they forgot to bring the sauce because he couldn't see it.  It is a cleanish cucumber sweet sauce.  Totally elevated the Rangoon.  The honey walnut shrimp were tasty with a light batter and lots of crunch.

I am addicted to pad Thai and I firmly believe that you can judge a thai restaurant by its pad Thai.  So I was really excited when I saw they had crazy pad Thai- a choice of duck or calamari.  I did the duck. And I have never been happier.  Part way through the meal I told my dad that I felt like a vacuum because I was just sucking it up.  The duck was so tender and succulent.  Just thinking about it again makes me happy.  Plus there were plenty of peanuts.

Enjoyed the meal.  I tried something different than I usually get which was the Geyser Shrimp.  Rice noodles with shrimp and veggies.  Very tasty.  But if you want it Thai hot, you are really going to have to emphasize that.  I asked for it Thai hot but got normal hot so had to add the spice myself.

Others in the party had the rice plate with pork and something else which was really good and a shrimp/bok choy dish.  

Service was fast on the food, slow on the drinks but that was in part because there was one server for the whole dining room and the bar was actually outside the restaurant in the casino.

Had the banana/wonton/cheesecake dessert.  Pretty good - tasted mostly of wonton and bananas.

One drawback was the loud techno music -- at 6pm.  Would have preferred something more soothing to match the wonderful decor and escape the 'ping ping' noises of the slot machines.

Reco going to Half Price tickets to get a 30% dining voucher as well.  Came in handy.

Everywhere I travel I am always looking to get a good bowl of Ph√¥ and I was extremely happy to find a place on the strip. Not only was it convenient but it was awesome! The options are simpler than a traditional Vietnamese restaurant but I was very pleased. A little pricy for Ph√¥ but you're on the strip. Slightly smaller portion as well but the flavor was excellent so I left a happy customer. Will definitely be back!

This place is located in Hotel Bally, really high end for a asian joint. I love how the seating which creating an illusion your sitting on the floor like Japanese style

If you craving Pho, this is the spot.  I had the Pho with Steak & Beef balls however it was so expensive like $18-20 a bowl.

The broth was really good however my rare Steak tasted wierd - not in a good way.
 I was really hungry  so I dipped the meat  with the hosin/sirracha which help cover the funky taste.

My friend ordered the Duck Soup and Love it!  He is a lite eater and I couldn't believed he finish the whole bowl (It was that good)

I would comeback again only because it's the only pho in this area.

the ambiance & service & food. Modern decor with a beautiful central pond  & floating dollars on lily pads ! Made a wish & left a buck ! The CALAMARI was perfect. Crispy, not too dry & seasoned well with a lovely sauce. I've never had COCONUT SOUP with such huge TOFU chunks ! Perfect ! partied so much & ate so much fried food it was nice to have a plate full of veggies and shrimp!  I'll definitely go back. Thanks Vegas for a great Thai fix! One of my fave food genres !

My husband and I came here for our anniversary. We got a groupon before hand which made our experience even better since this place is more expensive than what we usually pay for dinner. 

We had the chicken lettuce wraps and they came with a delicious peanut sauce. My husband ordered their most popular curry, according to the menu, and was very happy with it. It was amazing. I wish I had gotten it too! I got a chicken basil dish which was ok. The basil flavor was too strong for me and I couldn't finish. 

We sat by the little water stream. It's a nice little touch. The restaurant is quiet considering it's located in a loud casino. It was good experience.

She sells seashells by the seashore
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sea-the-thai-experience-las-vegas#72KODOc9wIrLiJCmEbU6Ew

30% off via Tix4Tonight deal of $2/person

Living out our inner Katniss & going through our "Hunger Pains", we needed something yummy to fill our tummies.  Not being in the mood for a burger or whatever fried crap available, we thought Thai food sounded good.

SEA:The Thai Experience is located back in the boonies of Bally's Hotel & Casino.  The cuisines served are both Thai & Vietnamese.  The ambiance was rather nice, with the center of the restaurant having a fountain pool with a Buddha statue, surrounded by wood tables.  On the periphery, standard tables to dine at, with a private area for large parties.

Being Vegas, we knew we shouldn't expect prices similar to the local haunts back home.  I was almost taken aback as to how much things were, but with 30% off, it helped sweeten the sour taste of overpriced food.

Fried calamari($12)-
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sea-the-thai-experience-las-vegas#GfhhEFZn2GCeSDFfXlbYiA
Lightly breaded calamari, fried to a nice texture, accompanied with sweet chili sauce.  Nice & chewy, these were really good.  I'm a big squid fan, and I enjoyed each fried piece from the sea.  

Pad Thai, with beef ($18)-
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sea-the-thai-experience-las-vegas#yUTLbpFitScqvHh75IGvBQ
Sweet, sour & filling, the pad thai had fair portions & was as good as any that I've had dining at my favorites.  

Honey walnut shrimp fried rice ($18)-
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sea-the-thai-experience-las-vegas#dUTI_D4Rxdqi6-iHIxXNUA
Winna, winna!  The highlight of our meal, the honey walnut shrimp fried rice  made me want to pop a wheelie in a Tuk-Tuk down Las Vegas Blvd.  Crunchy walnuts & bell peppers, a pleasing amount of deveined shrimp with a medley of vegetables  wok-tossed with seasoned rice.  The portions were great, and I relished this dish, since we only had appetizers for dinner the night before.  

Service was on the slow side.  The place wasn't too busy when we arrived, so I didn't understand why our food took longer than necessary.  Our drinks were kept filled & we had a nice meal, enjoying Thai music & the sound of falling water from the Buddha fountain.  

In summation, we had a nice Thai lunch at SEA:The Thai Experience.  Would I dine here w/o the Tix4Tonight deal?  Heck no!  Way too expensive for stuff that's 3 times more costly than restaurants I usually go to.  However, the food was good & we were happy.  Furthermore, the ambiance was a nice respite from the frenzy of the Strip.

Recommend with the 30% off Tix4Tonight deal

Got a Groupon for the five of us for dinner - food was decent, came here cause I was craving Asian and didn't want to go far. I think I'm spoiled by good, cheap NYC Thai food because this was very mediocre. I would never pay for this in the city, but when you're in Vegas you tend to shell out $$$ for food that is just okay.  My brother ordered the curry (which was already $21) and then we had to pay $3 for the rice. The Asian in me was like "man this ain't right" but I did it anyway cause rice is life. I got the pad kee mao, it was decent, nothing to write home about. Cute decor, I was with my family so didn't get to sit next to the fountains, but I think that would have been nice.
The drinks were good, but that's all.  Food was mediocre and service was terrible.  Not worth the price tag.

I liked the short ribs! And the red curry with duck was great, too. Because we liked the food we had on the first night, we went back to this place another day. That time, the pork chops weren't as great as the short ribs. The drunken noodle was not as spicy as we requested. We still like the short ribs and red curry, so we give this place four stars. But your experience depends on what you order.

Below average in all areas (but the shrimp). The pho had decent flavor but the texture of the scallops and squid was below average, however the shrimp texture was great. The peanut noodle my girlfriend got was okay. I would never pay for the quality they offer and the poor service they provide.  The waiters didn't ask how the meal was and did not ask if we wanted to take home the leftovers (I was barely able to muster the courage to eat half). The only truly good thing about this restaurant is the decor. I am leaving a restaurant unsatisfied for only the second time at any restaurant in my life..

This place is pricey for Thai food it it is Vegas so we expected the prices to be up there. The decor is very nice. The front of the restaurant has two hanging egg chairs which is cool because no one else has it! We ordered the lollipop chicken but it was a busy so don't get it. We got the coconut rolls instead and that was tasty!  My husband ordered the spicy pork belly and it was so hot and spicy he was sweating while eating it. I ordered the garlic chicken with mixed veggies. That was delicious!  I would recommend this place to others fruit are in Las Vegas and in the Bally's or Paris hotel .

We came here to celebrate a birthday. Didn't know it, but there aren't a lot of thai restaurants on the strip. 

We came in and were at the front for about 10 seconds before a server came up and let us know that someone would be right there to help us.

Since we were celebrating, we ordered a bottle of chardonnay to go with our meal. Our server came back to tell us that they were out of bottle we ordered, but would give us the next best wine at the same price of the bottle we ordered. I thought that was really nice of her.

Now for the food: Crab miso soup was awesome but came out warm not hot. Still great though. Chicken and shrimp dumplings were amazing. Best food item we ordered. Once again... Dumplings are a must have. For dinner, my wife and I split 2 entrees: the spicy soba noodle and shrimp fried rice. As a precautionary, we went with a level 2 spice. Holy God it was spicy. Just be careful when choosing your spice levels here. For me, I loved it. The wife, not so much. But it was still so good it forced her to power through. The white wine was a nice balance for the spicy dishes.

Let me begin with that I have been in the hospitality industry for many years and I understand the business very well! I have been a server, bartender, and even managed restaurants. I am usually very understanding of issues that may arise, but this dinning experience was the first time in my life I have went to a manager to complain ever! I was unhappy with my food and the server said that he would take my dish off the bill. I was eating my husbands food because the beef In my pho was chewy and uneatable. When the server cleared the plates without asking I still had chopsticks in my hand eating off his plate....since I could not eat my own food which no one offered to fix, even after my comments about the food not being up to par ( also that wasn't the first time he tried to clear our plates while we were still eating). At the end of our meal the server stated that he would take my "RARE" STEAK PHO off the bill. Upon receiving the bill to my "surprise" considering the service.... this item was still on the bill. I went to the host stand and asked to speak to a manager, I explained to him what had happened and to my surprise the server came up and had the nerve to argue with me about the situation in front of his manager. The manager was good in the sense of telling him to apologize and pretty much just agree with me. That isn't what I was looking for but it was the right move!(from the in the biz prospective, you never argue with a guest once a manager is involved! That is what they are there for!) I have never in my personal or working life experienced such an unprofessional dinning experience from a server (IHOP has provided better service to their guest). I personally work at an establishment that receives many Yelp reviews. I am almost always mentioned by name (which I couldn't tell you our servers name,because he never told us) in multiple 5 star reviews due to my friendliness, attentiveness, and proper service! I have never felt the need to go to a manager in regards to a server before and I have never had one argue with me in front of management! This is why I am giving this establishment a 1 star review, if I had ever pulled a stunt like our server did I would be promptly unemployed!!!! There is no excuse for what happened and that server is lucky I understand the biz because if he had to deal with the cliental I deal with he would be cleaning bathrooms at the local Walmart!
Was craving Thai food and this place hit the spot. The chicken pai thai and beef pai thai are delish! My hubby also got one of the green curries and he loved it.
Omg I love Thai food.. this place was so yummmyy.. It's dark and quiet and very nice date place.. the service was good.. food was fast..

Enjoyed the food, ambiance, and service. Food came quick and was very flavorful. The seats by the water are a nice relaxing way to have dinner. We completely enjoyed the experience. Nothing bad to say about any of it.

The ambiance is cool with the water pool and statue, and the pomegranate/mint/vodka drink was fantastic. We had a coconut shrimp appetizer, which was ok (might have been a little over cooked). I had a spicy green curry with shrimp, peas, peppers, and bamboo shoots, and my girlfriend had a special dish with scallops and vegetables. I liked the spiciness of my dish, but the rest of the meal was just "good". Given the prices, I wish it had been a little more special.

I can't speak for the authenticity of the dishes offered , but my husband and I really enjoyed our meal here !  I will say it's not necessarily pure Thai, since it has other Asian fusion influence, but not complaining because it was so yummy!!  Prices are definitely on the high side , but using Groupon made it very reasonable, especially when considering the ambience and the quality and quantity of the food we received (Huge shareable appetizers of honey Walnut shrimp and calamari, followed by very flavorful and balanced Malay curry, and perfectly cooked drunken noodles with topped with roasted duck.  Our main server was very sweet, knowledgeable , and attentive, and I loved  how the whole staff  seemed to have the teamwork thing down pat and kept us taken care of the whole time without being intrusive while we enjoyed the ambience.  Tip: they also offer discounts at the tix4tonite kiosks which I think would be worth it for a larger party if you can't access a Groupon.   The restaurant seemed to have quite a few Groupon users though  and staff happily redeemed them and treated us with stellar service the whole evening.  I would subtract one star because receipt was confusing  at the end (waitress admitted the way it is set up was indeed confusing to many patrons and sincerely apologized ), but I still found the overall total more than reasonable considering everything so I decided not to mull over it, and rated 5 stars since I don't agree with the 3.5 star average here on Yelp!  I feel the overall average needs to go up to at LEAST a solid 4 so people don't miss out and are more likely to give this amazing place a try!;)

The food was decent. Having a China town around the corner I was not too impressed but hey: it was ok food. However what ticked me off big time is an automatically added 20% gratuity for a party of 2. Haven't seen that in a while. I get automatic gratuity for larger parties, makes sense. But for a table of 2?
Good meal and great service.  We had a Groupon so it was a great deal. I got the shrimp pad Thai, and my wife got a different noodle dish.  Both had great flavor.

It pains me to remember how we couldn't sit in the awesome Benches Floating on Water area because we were one too many for the 4-seater benches. Despite being turned away from utter tranquility, I still have a found memory of this place.

Food: eh, nothing that I can't get for a lesser price. Not memorable.

Service: good! my friend with a laundry list of allergies had all her needs met! 

Decor: even though frugal ole' me spent $50 on this meal (and a LUNCH, at that!), I still gave it 4 stars which is a testament to good company and interactive furniture and decorations. We couldn't get enough of the transparent globe swings that hung from the ceiling!

There are only two places on the strip with Thai food that I know of. Lemongrass inside Aria and Sea inside Ballys.  


Can't knock the quality as I enjoyed meal. For Thai food it is pretty expensive but you are paying for location. 

No joke on the spicy level. A 4 out of 5 here means business! Next time I think I will go with a 3.

I had a wonderful dining experience at SEA. My family and I were staying at Bally's and decided to have dinner here. The classy and zen-like atmosphere is what made it special. Each of the tables surrounds a pond that stretches across the middle of the restaurant. 

The food was top-notch and the portion sizes were good. The presentation was also beautiful. For one our appetizers, we ordered fresh spring rolls, which all had different lengths and were laid vertically in a plate filled with dipping sauce. The only negative aspect of the food was the high prices.  The service was good but not excellent.  

This is a great place to go to for fusion Asian food, especially if you are staying nearby. However, I feel that a decent portion of what you are paying is for the ambiance.

The name of this restaurant is Sea - The Thai Experience.  However, the cuisine is more than just Thai, it also serves Vietnamese dishes.  The 4 of us came here to try it and we ordered the following:

1) Tom Ka Kai (Coconut Chicken Soup) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD09YgKsDtKD5sOYes6wg?select=lmAHepVByukDMOrWinBaoA.  This was quite good with lots of white chicken meat, mushroom, and baby corn.

2) Pad See Ew http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD09YgKsDtKD5sOYes6wg?select=w_wIIAPX2YUkzawuA9tY1A - I personally didn't try it but my guest liked it.  It looked good, so I'd take his word for it.  

3) Pad Kee Mao with Tofu http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD09YgKsDtKD5sOYes6wg?select=nUvoYj1Zn7M5W8rYXz1viQ.  This dish is also known as Drunken Noodle.  It was quite spicy with good flavor.  However, I didn't care for the tofu that was used.  Instead of fried tofu which has softer texture, it was the firm tofu (aka bean curb) which didn't take up seasoning well, therefore, tasted really blend.  

4) Pad Thai http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD09YgKsDtKD5sOYes6wg?select=2GRb1HNlVo0kdAxruvpU6A.  A huge disappointment.  Although it looked promising, the sauce was totally off.  It had a funny sour taste to it.  My guess was that the vinegar used was too much.  My fiance who is usually is a big fan could barely eat it.  He ended up ordering Chicken Fried Rice below.

5) Chicken Fried Rice http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jVD09YgKsDtKD5sOYes6wg?select=u7O2fDzz4VxtsVhikDg-uQ.  You wouldn't think an Asian restaurant could mess up fried rice, would you?  Ha.  Second disappointment.  It was bland and tasteless, according to my fiance.  I don't think I'd be able to convince him to come back here after having 2 bad dishes.  

The restaurant is kind of hidden in the back.  The decor is quite nice and staff is very friendly.  I think you can get better Thai food outside of the casino, but if you are too lazy to go out, this is not a bad alternative.  Just don't get the Pad Thai.  =)

Good decor and decent Thai food. Saw it on Groupon and decided to try it out. The ambiance was similar to a miniature version of TAO, the Tom Tom seafood was spot on. Satay chicken skewer and fried calamari was sublime. Unfortunately my favorite dish pad se ew was under-seasoned and generally underwhelming. It overall a good dining experience.

If you are In vegas and really craving some pho or Asian food it's going to cost you $18 for a bowl of pho. The good thing is that it is a large bowl and tasted pretty good! The way I see if you don't have a car to get to Chinatown then this will do!
Green curry excellent. I asked for Thai hot and it came out pretty hot... That's unusual in many places. Service was fast! Took about ten minutes when NY to go order when it wasn't too busy.
Had the duck curry - mediocre at best.  I guess I'm spoiled by all the great Thai food in SoCal and Minnesota.
This is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas & I always make a point to bring a group of friends! Amazing food & great atmosphere!

The food is good but definitely overpriced.
The ambiance is great for especially near the water area. 
Service is awesome as well. Very attentive and friendly.
We ordered coconut soup, Pad Thai and steamed rice. We were disappointed with the quality. The coconut soup was okay. The Pad Thai is probably the worst I have had. It was overly spicy and oily.
Everything taste good but execution was poor. They over cooked the noodles!!! Plate was a mess of mushy noodles.
This place feels like you're eating at a spa! Relaxing, zen decor with a center water feature. Food was really good, prices were reasonable, portions were sizeable. Definitely worth checking out!

Solid service in this hidden on the strip Thai place. Ambience and quiet are the highlights here. Food was pretty good. I chose the cashew chicken which didn't seem real spicy at level 5. I'll likely come back due to location and room noise isn't high which is rare on the strip. Lol.

I ordered the Phone.  As a Canadian I am appalled by how much cilantro and mint they add to the vietnamese food in the US. I dislike both. It wasn't stated on the menu so the first time my meal came out , I had to send it back. When it came out correct it was good. Not the best I've had though.  The service was okay as well.
The portion have gone down in size. It no longer comes ready to eat. You must mix all the spices and everything together. Very disappointing we come every year and the service was horrible this year.

After strolling the infamous Las Vegas Strip from the Sign to the Paris Hotel, we were ready to sit down & eat. Being that we are huge fans of the Original SEA Restaurant in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, NY, we were excited to experience the same in Vegas. Right? Wrong! SEA in Brooklyn is NOTHING like the SEA in Las Vegas. When we entered, the ambiance was the same. Oh! It's also located inside of a hotel lobby. So, we sat down near the indoor water & the server greeted us with a kind attitude explaining to us the menu. So, the first difference is the food, Brooklyn's SEA definitely tastes better than Las Vegas' SEA. The prices in Brooklyn are also more affordable (which makes SEA in Brooklyn so popular). I hate to have to compare but how can you not when the SEA in Brooklyn is Famous? So famous that they made one in Las Vegas to mirror the original. Therefore, I'll be sticking to the original SEA.

Worst food experience at Vegas at a pretty steep price. To top it off, both me and my husband fell sick after eating here.

The chicken satay was bland and cold. We asked the chicken massaman curry to be spicy and what came was a flavor less curry with dollops of red chili powder mixed in from the top. That probably caused us to fall sick. The fried rice was barely passable. 

Even the service was slow and lackluster. Please stay away from this place.

Just okay.  Very okay.  The thing that makes me question this place is the fact that their pad thai was marginal.  What kind of thai restaurant messes up a signature dish like that?!

Aside from the pad thai, the best thing I ate was the Malay curry.  It was not too spicy, and full of flavor.  Of course, I would be happy with pretty much any curry - but after trying their lack-luster pad thai, this was great in comparison.  We ordered it with tofu, which was a great decision in my opinion.  Tofu and curry are a perfect combo!  Make sure to order a side of rice with this though - it doesn't come with like you may expect.

The calamari was okay - nothing to brag about.  Same goes for the chicken lettuce wraps - they were not that great.  Really not that great.  I usually would eat 2 of these, but I had to force myself to finish one.  Don't order them, especially if you've ever tried PF Changs (which are 10x better, sadly).

The service was good, and the ambiance was the main redeeming quality.  It's a romantic setting, with modern, clean decor.  We were a very large party (around 15) and had our own private room with a TV.  Waiters and waitresses were quick to bring our food and clear the table.

I would definitely not come back here if I were in Vegas, there are so many other better restaurants to check out.

Thai dishes are good but I found Vietnamese dishes better.
The quality of food is good but i'm taking one star out as This is not the best Thai restaurant in town.
Good portion of Vietnamese Noodles.

The atmosphere is nice. Very nice place to dine. But the seats in the middle of the restaurants are very comfortable. there are no backrests. If you are two people, it might be good to sit there. If you are more than 3, i don't recommend.
The food here is great..I'm really picky about my Thai food. I recommend the pad Thai. The wait staff and everyone there is nice.

A great dining experience!  A girlfriend and I dined here after finding a Groupon for the restaurant that included two appetizers and two entrees for a reasonable price.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is very zen; it is not a huge space, so I would definitely recommend making a reservation.  We had made a reservation using Open Table, and once we arrived we were seated very quickly.  

Service was great.  I seem to always base service on how quickly my water glass is refilled throughout the meal--because I drink a lot of water!--and my glass definitely stayed filled.  Our waitress was very nice and friendly, as well as the other staff was very helpful as well.  

We both ordered the pad Thai for our main entree and the chicken lettuce wraps and coconut spring rolls for appetizers.  Everything was delicious!  The portions were very reasonable (if not too much), and the tastes of everything was great.  I would definitely recommend everything we ordered to anyone!  

Price for the restaurant seemed kind of steep, but for a nice restaurant in Vegas and the amount of food given, it's actually pretty reasonable.  Make sure to look on Groupon to see if they still have a special.  Next time I am in town I will definitely be going back to SEA, whether there is a Groupon or not!

one word: Soba. 

I don't eat Thai often but the last time I went to a Thai joint and asked for my dish to be really spicy, it was hardly that. At Sea, I ordered the soba noodles with beef and asked for it to come as spicy as possible and that's exactly what I got! I was so pleased.  Usually restaurants' version of spicy is pretty watered down but I left here with my lips burning 30 mins later! I love to feel the burn, ergo, I'm in love with this place. It was an orgiastic experience for my taste buds. The Thai iced tea was good as well as whatever my beau had. No time for dessert :'( 

Also, there was a guy there, the owner or manager (I'm unsure), that was very attentive and polite while I waited for my beau to arrive. The ambience is pleasant and seductive, dim lighting and interesting Thai inspired decor. I really hope I have time to come here again when I return to Vegas.

Food was delicious! No complaints there. 

The portions were generous but I did knock a star because it was definitely overpriced. 

The staff was very friendly and it was a nice setting. The lighting did mess with my eyes a bit.
Noodles and crab Rangoon were good. Service is slow and the staff looked/seemed stressed out. Kind of pricy too.
Geradliniges Ambiente, guter Service und sehr leckeres Essen. Sticky Lemongrass Chicken ist eindeutig zu empfehlen.

When you are in the mood for Thai, not much affordable choices around the Strip.  The dreaded "resort pricing" applies to Sea: The Thai Experience.  A glance at the menu and you would have to pay around $22 or pad thai, curry, or fried rice dishes which should be half the price outside the strip.

I ordered the shrimp tom yum for $16 which is the best "deal" in the menu and it's alright, competently done but nothing close to pay an extra $5 or more for this dish.

I would only recommend this place if you got comps to use and don't have a car to drive out.
Disgraceful service, then they expected a tip after woulds? No choice for vegetarians, come to the 21st century and upgrade your menu.

This restaurant can be hard to find bc its tucked away in a corner of Bally's Casino. However, it's very modern, romantic, and charming.
Food is fantactic, with large portions for the entrees. The pot stickers and satay appetizers are both tasty. The chicken curry and shrimp fried rice are 2 of my favs as well. Drinks are meh...
This place turned us on to Thai food. Thank you. Once you have tried Thai you will nevet go back to Chinese!

This place has all the classic Thai dishes down. Whether it be curry or noodles or soup they definitely have it down. The setting is nice with the water pond in the middle. Only complaint I have is that it is pretty pricey. $22 for a soup or small portion of pad Thai didn't seem quite worth it.

The fact that this restaurant seated us just before midnight earns them an extra bonus star-- Great service and really good food make it a solid four-star. We called and tried several restaurants on a friday night and were basically shut out at the eleven-thirty ish hour. When SEA answered and sounded delighted to have us come, we were more than pleasantly surprised. 
Patty, our server, was kind and friendly and sold the mad russian on a special saki that they had at discount and actually dissuading her from heating it up. This one she said was best served cold. Bonus points added. Nothing special about the beers my sister and I had, but we really enjoyed the pond side seating we had with the floating lotus flowers.
What we had:
Crab Rangoon
Fritters
Golden Crab Roll
Crazy Pad Thai
Scallop Stir Fry
All of the food was very good and we enjoyed a great meal so late at night. As far as we could tell, they made no short cuts on food or service. Well done!

We went there in beginning of April. 
Found this place by accident when I was cruising  around casino, waiting for my wife. Menu looked interesting, decor looked fine - so, why-the-hell-notski :)

We got there for dinner and got a place by the pond (well, a little pool of water right in the middle of the restaurant). 
A bit loud at first, even some unhappy faces (for some reason) but once we got an appetizer, Fresh spring rolls - just like in Vietnam :) 
Than we got drunken man noodles and East West Shrimp. For shrimps it said "Load of shrimp" on the menu - they really mean it!!! 
Drunken man noodles were fantastic !!! Shrimps were awesome!!! Taste was just right!!!
Service was wonderful, waiter was on time, with no extra stupid checkups.   
Only a bit weird thing was, their alcohol, beer, wine etc. is served from a small restaurant next door. And they will bring you a separate check :)

The best thing was, I cut myself tapping to the very nice techno bit in the middle of our dinner, which was pretty loud... but sure enough - some bi*h complained.... cause it went away in a second.

So... that is all for my experience... 
VERY recommend if you like Thai / Vietnamese food and great service!

Got a Groupon for this one and visited this place. We ordered coconut crusted shrimp and tup tim fritters in appetizers. Both the items were delicious and worth a try.   Island red curry and spicy thai herb fried rice were the main course. In both dishes the vegetables were cut in big pieces and had to chew hard to eat; though the taste was good. Next day i had upset stomach ...
Went with the family. Super expensive, 30 a dish, but great service  super expensive

Nice decor with a large Thai Buddha waiting for you in the seating area.  All the servers humbly  helped each other out on every table making it a wonderfully calming "Thai Experience". The soup was deliciously cooked traditional lThai style.  After our dinner we order a couple of the Mango Sticky Rice dishes for dessert and it was delicious!  The check came to $250 for a family of five which was not the Thai Experience!

I was worried coming here because there were few people here at 7 and from reading reviews. But the service was great. And the food was awesome. I had the Malay massaman curry. Perfect spiciness. And the mango margarita was more of a martini but it was awesome. I definitely recommend this place. And sit by the lotus pond if you can.

We had a Groupon for two appetizers and two entrees, and made a reservation for the evening.  It was pretty busy when we got there.  They had a cute set-up inside.  We sat at wooden bench-like seats that were next to a little water area with floating flowers.  For the appetizers, we got the Chicken Lettuce Wrap and the Fried Soft Shell Crab, which was on a special menu, and that soft shell crab was amazing!  For the entrees, we ordered the Sticky Lemongrass Chicken and the Holy Basil Seafood Combo.  They were both delicious, and you can taste the great quality of the food.  Nice presentation and service was wonderful.

This place is visually appealing. Yet it seems that was it.  Calamari was rubbery. The fritters over fried. The pitcher we ordered. Was so watered down, we asked for sugar to sweeten it up, 10 mins later someone who was not our waiter finally helped us out.. dinner, oh boy I don't know if they just threw it together to get us out, " we where the last ones there" but come on, out of four of us adults, none of us enjoyed it at all. My salad was half onions. Maybe it was just a glitch, but $200+spent,  for a plate full of onions, and over cooked steak, half Roma tomatoes in the rice, is not what I expected.
Great service and the food was spectacular! In a city where food is outrageously prices, this place was reasonable.  The portions are large and unique. Highly recommend!

Great service! Great Thai food! They even had mango sticky rice and I hadn't been able to find it at any Thai restaurant since falling in love in with the dessert in Thailand and returning home. The server recommended the Green Curry with Soba noodles and egg. WOW! it was amazing, not on the menu but happy to create a new experience for me. We will definitely go back.

I really liked the food. The honey walnut prawns were good, but different from the usual. The chicken satay was great! The volcano chicken was also really good. Minus 1 star for my crispy duck skin confit. The duck skin was chewy not crispy. Other then that dinner was great!

been here twice now.  the food is tasty and on the sweeter side.  the presentation is nice, and the portion size is appropriate - not too much, not too little.  

if you can get away from the strip, i'd highly suggest lotus of siam.  however, if you stuck on the strip and need a quick fulfilling bite of thai food and don't mind the cost, this hits the spot.

had the pad see ew tofu and the panang chicken with brown rice.  both were satisfying.
Not a fan of this place.  For the price (which is a lot), the curry is fairly bland and uninspired.  Maybe it was a bad night but then again maybe this is a bad review.

During a recent trip to Las Vegas, my friends and I purchased a Groupon deal for SEA and I must say that discounts like that are the way to go when dining on the strip due to the horrific prices. I really do like Thai food quite a bit, but at the time I wasn't sure that would be my first choice for a Vegas weekend as there are so many great cuisines in the city, but SEA far exceeded my expectations. One of the girls and I decided to split a Pad See Ew plate because we never finish a full order anywhere else and knew that we would not be eating leftovers that weekend. We ultimately decided on beef at the suggestion of our waitress and she did not steer us wrong. The beef was so tender that it all but melted in my mouth and the noodles had just the right amount of soy sauce flavor. The bok choy were wonderfully cooked as well, though I do prefer it when there are other veggies as well. I will say that this was the smallest portion of Pad See Ew I've ever received (and the most pricey), so that part was a little disappointing since I was sharing with someone. 

The service was wonderful, but did slow down a bit towards the end of our meal. One of my friends ordered a Thai Iced Tea not realizing that it is made with cream. She is lactose intolerant and our waitress had no issue substituting the already prepared Thai Iced Tea for a regular Iced Tea and that was much appreciated. 

The ambiance was very cozy with a little darker lighting, which would make for a wonderful date night dinner on the strip. It did get crowded toward the end of our meal, but our 7:30PM reservation came with a more calm atmosphere. 

Overall, I'd highly recommend SEA, but try to get the Groupon deal!

I would rate Sea as an average restaurant in Las Vegas. The pricing was reasonable, and the food was average.We wanted a light meal so we went with a couple of appetizers. The honey walnut shrimp was tasty, the appetizer portion had about 10 shrimp, but there was way too much breading on them. The spring rolls were good, especially the sauce that they were in. This was also a decent size portion. My friend that got the pad Thai, she said it was average.

I would recommend this restaurant if you want something low-key.

It is my second time here and from what I recalled from my first trip (company paid) and it still seemed very expensive. It has been a few yeas but it definitely went up a few $. My partner told me about a Travelzoo deal $50 for 2 apps up to $15 each and 2 entrees up to $28 for lunch. They were really nice when we brought it up and was patient with us since we purchased it while we were there. 

We got the fried shrimp appetizer with a spicy mayo type of sauce. Good quality and batter was tasty. Also got the steam dumplings, big portion and good quality.

For entrees, they did have some specials, the plates varied from Vietnamese, Korean, etc. Kind of threw me off since I thought it was a Thai restaurant experience but it's more Asian Fusion. We got the pad see ew chicken, big portion good quality chicken but the greens were ok, not well seasoned. I got the masasam curry which said it was rated top 10 dishes. They asked for spice level 1-5, a 2 was very mild. The dish was ok but had a good portion of beef. None of the entree came with rice so we order a side order for $5. They bring it in a cute pyramid shape however, the portion was super small, not equivalent to the curry. 

Other things to note, the service in my opinion was excellent. I think we spoke to everyone in the restaurant. Ambiance is very cute, try to sit on the benches along the water. Thai tea is very delicious! 

Overall, we did have to pay extra for the rice, Thai tea, tax, etc. after we tip off the original amount the total came to $80 (with Travelzoo deal). In my mind, yes we did save money but $80 for a Thai lunch is expensive for 2. $28 entrees is a bit excessive for lunch. I felt they could have done a lunch combo platter or 2/3 course meal. Plus, after the meal, I immediately didn't feel great. 

3/5-hit or miss but overall not a mind blowing Thai experience.

Overall, I would never go back to this restaurant again.  We ate with a party of 6 and for 6 entrees, two appetizers and a normally "cheap" bottle of wine, ended up spending $310.  The food was meager at best, and I would almost classify it as a rip-off. I ordered a caesar salad for an appetizer and it was lettuce, fried wontons and carrots. Nothing else.  10$ - and probably had $1.50 in ingredients. I ordered duck confit for my entree and I was not asked how I wanted it prepared and it came out well done, if not a little more so. Avoid at all cost.

We just ate dinner here and while the atmosphere was nice (we sat by the pond in the middle of the restaurant) and the food tasted great, the full menu advertised on Caesar's website was obviously old and was at least 4-8$ cheaper, so we were shocked to see the prices in person after getting a table. I was hungry for Thai so we stayed. I picked the shrimp tom yum (soup), which for $16, was closer to being reasonably priced, compared to the $22+ for meals. In all, good food, high prices.

We really enjoyed our meal here. We had the crazy pad Thai with duck and the Ginger and broccoli with shrimp. We can't exactly remember the names of the dishes but we do remember that they were delicious. The waiter was very helpful in giving us suggestions and was very attentive. Last time we were in Las Vegas we couldn't find this restaurant as we forgot our cell phones so we had to eat somewhere else. This time we checked to see where it really was before heading out to eat. This restaurant is in the Bally's Casino. The restaurant decor is relaxing and the place was full when we finished our meal. We highly recommend this restaurant and we will return next time we are in Vegas and want some tasty Thai food.

Found this place on Yelp. We didn't make reservations but it was a Wednesday night in April so we just walked in. We were seated right away. The ambiance is simple yet elegant. They have a cool reflective pond with built in tables around it. Fairly traditional menu. Almost everything was under $30. The waitress came to take our drink order shortly after we sat down. Then took our food order. We started with the Coconut Spring rolls (4) and I ordered the cashew stir fry with chicken and my SO ordered the massaman curry with chicken. You can order your spicy level from 1-5.  5 being Thai spicy, so we both ordered a level 4. 

The coconut spring rolls tasted fresh and crunchy. Very hot (temp). Let them cool first! I thought the dipping sauce had fresh flavor but was not very flavorful (if that makes sense).   My SO though that it might be dragonfruit sauce.

The massaman curry had a flavorful curry broth with chunks of potato and onion and a fair amount of chicken. Very flavorful, really liked it. On the spice level, it was a little on the mild side. 

Cashew stir fry was also very flavorful but had no spice, even though I ordered a level 4. We got some sauces on the side which were really yummy and spiced things up a bit. 

We didn't have room for dessert (so sad) but we really enjoyed eating here. I recommend this place if you like Thai food.

Loved the ambiance of this place!  It is small, so there is a need for reservations.  Took the kids with us and we would again, there are some kid friendly dishes.  We were sat promptly which we appreciated because a lot of places on the strip still have a wait even with reservations.  Staff was very friendly and efficient even with the restaurant being full.  We had several different dishes, the Calamari was very good and tender.  Honey Walnut Shrimp was delicious and very fresh tasting not like it was pulled from a freezer.  My only complaint was the Ribeye salad, although the steak itself was flavorful and tender, the dressing was a bit over powered with fish sauce.  It is a bit in the expensive side but the portions are reflective of the pricing.  Had a great experience......we will be back! Keep Yelpin Y'all!

We do not typically eat Eat on the strip as we are locals; however, we were going to a show and figured we will try this restaurant.  Truly a fantastic meal. We had the Volcanic chicken, chicken fried rice, a garlic vegetable dish ( forgot the name but has bean sprouts too) and a beef curry. There were 3 hungry young men and myself and this was plenty of food. I highly recommend
Slow, slow, slow service. Sit down ahead of someone else and they get served before you???? Really? 40 minute+ wait for rice and beef? That's a no go!!!

Can we all agree on something here?

That, when in Las Vegas, you are going to pay more for the basics?

Booze, smokes, food, everything, it's all just a bit more (or a LOT). So when i can find a place that's open late and serves really good food, even if it's a few bucks more than i would pay elsewhere, I'm stoked.

We found Sea after arriving late on a business trip. I was looking for something resembling supper so i wouldn't be stuck eating a pre made cafe sandwich for $12. We asked a cocktail waitress and she mentioned the cafe (shocking) and almost off the cuff, Sea. I love me some Thai, so we rolled.

Seats are half table and chair, half blocks of wood next to a pool. If your back is fickle, ask for the table and chair.

So, the chow; i had Drunken Noodles, a dish i would have all the time at a local place in Pasadena while i was working there. It wasn't on the menu when i would have it, i though it was just something the chef would whip up based on what i liked. But lo and behold, here it appears on the menu and once brought to me, it was PERFECT. Flat noodles in a spicy brown sauce with basil, peppers and onions, chicken and garlic. Incredible.

The waitress was on the ball the whole time, the food was great and in Vegas terms, it didn't break the bank. All around win. When conference comes around, i expect to eat here nightly.

Great food. Good environment. Amazing staff. Groupon deal or otherwise is expensive.
The water in the middle is very relaxing and a great place to take a date.
Side note..i lost a lot of money on the way in...keep your eyes on the prize!

There are a ton of okay restaurants on the Strip but this place is definitely a hidden gem in the back of Bally's. When you walk in most of the tables are around this fountain/small pond in the center of the restaurant that gives a laid back vibe. 

The food is excellent, with the spring rolls having more flavor than most with some lemongrass and weren't greasy at all. The Panang curry with beef was likewise top notch with lots of meat and string beans in a sauce that has some spice but isn't burning a hole in your tongue.

The service is very friendly and fast here and it wasn't too packed on a weekday night but I made online reservations since I wasn't sure.

A smaller version of the original locations in Williamsburg and Meatpacking (NY) yet this restaurant still managed to encompass the delicious cuisine, abstract decorum and overall coolness of the others. Nice!

I have loved Sea since it open in Brooklyn many years ago.  It has been a while since I have been so it was a treat to go ... after a recommendation from Niki C.

My friend and I order basics ... the Chicken Pad Thai, Crab Rangoons and the Tup Tim Fritters (two fried goodness dishes).

All was delicious and the ambience was cute, resemling the amazing set up in Brooklyn.

Came to Las Vegas for the weekend and after seeing the menu to Sea, I had to try it. We went early on Sunday morning right when it opened. Jessie took care of us and he was polite and awesome. 

The food . . . awesome as well! It's hard to find a great Thai place. Even in Las Vegas. The ingredients were fresh, the customer service was great, over all, next time I'm in Las Vegas I'm sure I'll stop by and grab a bite here.

I stayed at Ballys during my stay in Vegas so Sea was right down in the lobby for us We came here for lunch because being from NYC we've both had Sea in Brooklyn.
For the fellow NYers who might be reading this. Its the same thing, just a smaller version. Its nice for lunch, no one is really there. Its quiet and nice to relax after a long night or grabbing a bite before heading to the pool.
Unfortunately I dont remember what I ate but Im sure I liked it. I do remember drinking a Pomegranate Margarita which I loved!

Average thai food. I had the stir fried greens and rice (rice is separate from entree). My friend had the pad thai and it was way too saucy for me, unlike other pad thais i have tried in the past. I liked the decor and overall ambiance and I have to say that service was attentive. The actual restaurant was pretty small but intimate. However, At the end of the day, Its still overpriced thai food.

Yelp's 365 Review Challenge 2015 #14 - #365

My family was craving for some Asian food and did not want to walk too far from the hotel. So we found the SEA Thai Restaurant just across from rj hotel elevators. I never heard of this restaurant in Bally's so I'm assuming it just recently opened. The wait was around 15-25 minutes and the inside looked full, so it must be that good. The decor was modern and also had a small fountain inside the restaurant. 

I love love Thai food with their different uses of curry on their entrees and chicken barbecue. Lighting was pretty dim and I see they were going for an intimate setting. Flat screens were around the dining area and was Putin the Vevo channel with no sound. The food had taken about 30 - 45 minutes because it was so busy. Speaking of food, the chicken barbecue, curry beef, spicy rice and pad Thai were all a hit. It reminded me of the small Thai restaurant not too far from our place that serves good food. Our waitress forgot to fill up our waters and we were so thirsty after eating he spicy curry beef. 

The prices were typical for a Vegas strip hotel at $$$. I wouldn't call this place fancy and I have eaten at fancy eateries in Vegas. I would rate SEA Thai in the middle. I prefer to go to China town for some cheap eats compared to eating in the strip.

This is a pretty cool place. The atmosphere is accented with low lighting, and an eclectic mix of down tempo cool chill music that somehow works. 

I had the Pineapple Fried Rice with Chicken and it was awesome! Very large portion which could easily serve two. And the Thai Tea was delicious!

On our third day in Paradise, Cary was craving thai food and found SEA through yelp. The restaurant is really pretty inside and we got to sit in the area of the fountain and the statue. We had ordered calamari to start and the pad kei mao (drunken noodles) and the herb fried rice for the entrees. THe food was really good but because it is Vegas, I think they really lacked out on the heat. When I asked how spicy the food will be, I heard "oh really spicy!" We ordered both entrees with 4 stars because we didn't want to be idiots and order it too spicy if it's already "really spicy." Like I said, the food was good but the heat wasn't there and the price is ridiculous! 18 bucks for a plate that I know I can get for half the price somewhere else..... 

The service was alright, not the best. I had ordered a thai tea upon sitting at our table and NEVER got it. We had to ask for water and out waiter never came around to our table after we had ordered our food. The place was packed but it wasn't busy since I can see the buss boy and waiters and waitresses standing around chatting. The noise level  here is pretty loud considering that the restaurant is right next to the lounge area in Bally where they have a stage for performances, singing and dancing. I think I will try to find another thai restaurant that's cheaper, more attentative, and have heat the next time I'm in Vegas.
It's was ok not the best Thai food in town. Doesn't really taste like Thai food at all.  About the only good thing with this place was the service which was exceptional. Dessert was good too.

Stopped in at 11:00 on a Friday night. There were a few occupied tables, but halfway through our meal we were the only ones left. Sat by the water and had the three island appetizer platter to share, a couple of beers and the pho tai. Food was great, service was friendly. A nice change for late night munchies.

Like some of the other reviewers here, I thought the appetizer set the bar high and the entree did not quite reach it.  We had the coconut spring rolls and they came with an amazing sauce.  They really were quite delicious.  

For an entree I had the ginger/pineapple chicken, and my wife had the mango dish.  Both were good, but nothing special.

The service was excellent, and the decor was very nice.  The title for 3 stars is perfect, it was A-OK.

It's hard to believe that we tried almost every other Thai restaurant in Vegas before we made it to SEA. I'm not sure what stopped us, although we haven't stayed at Bally's for years, and SEA is tucked in behind the casino floor in kind of an out-of-the-way spot.  

The food was so good we went back twice on the same trip.  The service can be a little slow at times, but I'm not rushing through the meal anyway, so it didn't matter much. But the servers are friendly, even if there is somewhat of a language barrier at times, but that's nothing new for many Thai places.  

One odd thing is that the rice is an extra charge, which is the first time I've seen that at a Thai restaurant.  

But it's good food and it saves you a cab ride to Lotus, Satay, Krung Siam, Le Thai, Komol, or any of the other comparable Thai places in Vegas.

Hipster Thai. It's not the most authentic restaurant in the world but the ingredient quality is unmistakably good. Average food, but an elevated experience because the service is pleasant and attentive without being overbearing, and the atmosphere is modern and chic, with a beautiful reflection pool in the middle of the restaurant.

We ordered the 4 Seasons roll (great crunch), the chicken satay (average), and for entrees, Asian Jungle curry and Eat Your Greens stir fry. The curry was the better dish of the two, with a nice warmth from fresh peppercorns and an earthiness from basil. The Eat Your Greens, while the veggies were flash-fried to a perfect crispness, retaining much of the snap and bite, the sesame oil disappeared in the garlic sauce, and despite my request to make it "super spicy," there was absolutely no spice whatsoever, and the amount of chili sauce required to get a little heat out of the dish distorted its flavor with its vinegar and salt.

It's a nice atmosphere for a date night - quiet, set away from the casino floor - but the food is definitely watered-down compared to spots like Lotus of Siam or Komol. Come here if you can get a Groupon - but I wouldn't pay full price.
The food was excellent!! The service was fast! The ambiance is perfect!! Perfect date nite pick!!

We wandered around a bit, and Yelp didn't say it was INSIDE Bally's.  We wandered a bit, but it was solo worth it!  The atmosphere is private but casual.  The meals were amazing!  I had Rama the King with chicken - it was perfect.  My coworker had Drunken Noodles and gave me a bite - again, it was amazing.
Glad we stuck it out to find the place.
Price was reasonable too and the portions were generous without being too large.

Bought the groupon to save a little money but felt like we still paid too much for average food. Seafood noodle soup seemed to have zero seasoning/flavor. Did not get any sauces until we had to ask half way through.

The ambience is intimate with low lighting. This restaurant is inside Bally's and with walking distance if you stay in Paris Hotel. Food tasted good and service is great. However, the cost of two glasses of wine were $34???. We will only revisit this restaurant with a Groupon deal.

SEA had a Groupon that brought us in to visit.  I didn't expect much but was pleasantly surprised.  Service was fast and friendly.  Most of the food was very good.  The only exception being the Chicken Satay, I would recommend passing on that.

Ordered:
Chicken Satay
Vegetable Spring Rolls
Chicken Fried Fries (4 out of 5 Spicy)
Shrimp Pad Thai

Overall: I had low expectations visiting and was very pleased with the food and our experience.  Decor is great and the Thai food is the best Asian food I've had on the strip.
I loved the Thai coffee, Thai tea and spicy herb fried rice (Thai). Everything is uber pricey in Vegas and this is not an exception

This place sucks now! 

2 years ago they had a Vietnamese menu with pho, vermicelli, rice plates and bun rieu. They changed their menu and we asked the server about the old menu, he said (in broken English) the chef "went away" (we thought he said "ran away")... And that's exactly what we should have done when we heard that there's a new chef! RUN AWAY NOW!! 

They still have Vietnamese pho but more Thai now. The WORST pho ever! My sister found a hair AND a bug in her soup! She asked them to take it back and they took forever for another one, she wasn't hungry after waiting another 30 minutes for pho. My other sister found a hair net in hers but she decided to just eat it. The pho was lukewarm, the broth was salty and since it wasn't even hot the meat didn't cook and it stayed raw. My friend asked if they could just microwave her pho for it to be hot and cook the meat, again it took forever. How long does it take to microwave it? The only good dish was the drunken noodles, which wasn't exactly hot as well. We also got the seafood soup and it was cold, and too sweet. It's like they let it sit out... I don't think the chefs in the back are actually chefs, they probably hired a chef school drop out... I mean, pho soup should be hot, not lukewarm. 

You probably wondering, why are we getting pho on the strip? And not go to china town... We didn't have cars and were hungover and SEA is across from our hotel, trust me, paying $21 dollars for nasty ass cold pho with hair and bugs was not what we were looking for... This place should close down, it's a disgrace to Pho restaurants out there. I'm ashamed that I ate this.

My family and I had dinner here during the week night, and it wasn't too busy.  We were seated right away at a table near the water fountain and had a nice view of the Buddha statue and with a pretty lotus flower sheer screen backdrop.  The restaurant has a nice tranquil ambiance with romantic dim lighting and modern Asian design. The service was friendly and attentive.  We had the tup tim fritters appetizer which were crispy chicken & shrimp dumplings with a chili sweet-sour sauce for dipping.  For dinner, we had pad thai with chicken and shrimp, brown rice and the tamarind seafood combo with crispy fillet of tilapia, shrimp, scallops and squid in a spciy sweet and sour sauce.  Our Thai appetizers and entrees were delicious but pricey.

We loved this place! We planned a vacation using Groupon and this restaurant popped up, and we are so glad it did! The portions were huge, the atmosphere was very relaxed and the food tasted great! I highly suggest the noodle dish with honey duck broth!

What a treat; an absolutely extraordinary experience! From the moment we arrived we were seated promptly, given exemplary service and dined on fantastic food. It was not real busy as we were here for lunch, but there were two servers always waiting in anticipation for a customer's needs. We were checked on multiple times at our table. As for the atmosphere, SEA is intimate with water everywhere. After a long day of traveling to Vegas and waiting in lines this was the perfect place to come and relax.

I don't think I have ever had such Thai food. My friend Denise wouldn't shut up SEA for the rest of the trip. I actually had to convince her that we needed to explore the rest of Vegas, or we would have eaten every meal here.

We ordered a yummy cocktail, the pad thai and the panang curry. It was all perfect down to the white rice that came out sculpted into a little pyramid. Can I give SEA 6 stars?


Read more Las Vegas and Los Angeles reviews at my blog: http://rescuelashelters.wordpress.com/2011/07/06/the-best-of-the-las-vegas-strip/

Ordered takeout from our rooms at Bally's. Service was prompt and very nice. Coconut shrimp was amazing. Pad thai, not so much. It was good, but it wasn't anything to write home about. Just average. Had an odd smell too...
Very pretty atmosphere. The food is very good and the staff friendly. It is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.

SEA Thai is a hidden gem in the otherwise seedy Ballys Casino. We love Thai food and were attracted by their Groupon special. We have tried many Thai restaurants in Las Vegas and this was one of our best experiences. We requested a seat by the reflection pool and the ambiance was wonderful. 

We tried a calamari and a shrimp appetizer. Both of these were delicious and are large portions. The calamari was nicely breaded and had a nice dipping sauce that was not too sweet. The shrimp were tempura breaded and plentiful.

The appetizers were good, but the entrees were the star of the meal. We tried one version of there duck fried rice. It was rich, delicious and full of savory duck meat. We also tried a seafood hot pot soup which was served in a flaming hot potato volcano. The soup was full of seafood and was delicious!

Overall we were very happy with our experience and the groupon makes the prices acceptable. Recommended for a romantic date.

Very easy to find being located inside Bally's Hotel and Casino. Staff was extremely nice and accommodating with our group of 5 which also included our 1 year old son. For appetizers we ordered the cream cheese ragoons and the vegetable egg roll which were both extremely good. For dinner we have the vegetarian Bangkok Panang Curry, Pad Thai, and Fried rice. All dishes were up to par and did not lack taste.

Oh my god. This is bad. They hardly speak English. The food tastes like somebody with no idea threw it together. But the highlight: they charge you a 20%
Tip for their bad service.
Hey! I'd like to choose how much I tip. They just take 20% from you! Didn't like the service? No problem they charge you 20%. Absolute scum! Stay away from
This business! You have been
Warned!

I mainly eat home made Thai from the wife or in-laws so I only once in a while go out the house to eat it. An when I do, I never have high expectations. This place rock from the waiters to the whole look and feel of the restaurant. The food was amazing. Little on the pricey side for me to become a regular but I will be back.

My husband and I stumbled upon this place while searching for food in frenzied Las Vegas.  We had been turned away at The Steakhouse at Bill's for a second time (that's a longer story and I refuse to think that place is in such high demand that we couldn't get a table at 7pm on a Sunday).  Anyhoo, we noted there was a steakhouse at Bally's and headed over there.  We noticed SEA right next to the steakhouse and were just drawn in.  From the moment we walked in, we were impressed by the service.  We were seated immediately and when we noted the quieter, calmer area in back, we were welcomed to sit there.  It turned out to be a perfect romantic dinner :)  In addition, it isn't crazy pretentious like many other nice restaurants in Vegas.  Great food, friendly & attentive service, and warm atmosphere.  Here are the highlights...

-- Crispy Coconut Spring Rolls:  Perfectly crunchy and delicious, accompanied by a Lime Mustard Sauce that was sweet, tangy, and gently spicy.  The sauce was so good, we dipped the carrot garnish in it and kept noshing after the spring rolls were gone!
-- Thai Style Lobster Tail:  AMAZING.  The lobster tail was still in the shell, chopped into perfect chunks, then breaded and (apparently) fried.  I needed my husband's help to get the shell pieces off, but that just made the meal more fun!  The veggies were perfectly cooked and the sauce was like nothing I've had before.  Plus the amount of lobster was very generous.  Soooooo delish!
-- Crabmeat Fried Rice:  Hubby ordered this and it was really tasty!  It was full of lump crab meat and veggies, all blended together in a ridiculously good blend of flavors.  
-- Mad Dragon Friter:  This SEA version of fried ice cream was a perfect way to end our meal.  The crunchy coating was uniquely spiced (I have no idea what those spices were, but they were great!) and it was accompanied by delicate slices of mango.  Lovely.

Some people have said here that the service is "slow."  I disagree.  The service was exceptional and the staff left us alone long enough to get lost in conversation over our drinks, appetizer, meal, & dessert.  I believe this is the mark of a great restaurant...  I want time to enjoy my meal, especially when paying more than usual.  If you are looking for atmosphere, delicious food, and a special experience; you will get exactly that at SEA.  If you don't the like the company you keep, perhaps the service would seem slow... But don't take that out on the restaurant!

SEA is located in a far corner of the Ballys Casino.  Upon entering, the restaurant is uniquely decorated and had a calming and peaceful atmosphere, in contrast to the bright lights and noise of the casino.  I was seated at a table on the reflection pool which made for a nice backdrop.  The drunken man noodles were interesting with the combination of flavors and textures working well.  The crispy garlic prawn was full of taste and done very well.  The Panang curry was good as well.  I had it over sticky rice.  Overall, everything was pretty good with the drunken man noodles standing out for me.  Service was good as I never had to wait long for anything.  If you'd like a change from the normal Vegas buffet or need a change from all the fine steaks offered in Sin City, SEA would be a good choice.

The food was great And the waiter was informative. The lighting was a bit dim but it was not too bad it's am intamate setting perfect for a date. I was in a group of 4 and got sat at the table next to the water. There wasn't much arm/leg room for us it was a table meant for 2 other then that everything was great the food was delicious and flavorful

A true life-saver. With 2 hour plus lines everywhere else, this literally saved the day - was our wedding anniversary, and great food and ambience to boot. Got seated by the zen pool. Love this place. Would definitely go back.

Nice ambience, love the seating arrangement besides "Buddha in the water". Love the tom kha soup, creamy and delicious with veggies. The Siamese fried rice was flavorful and cooked spicy as I requested.

Omg! I'm so happy we decided to check this place out for dinner on our last night in Vegas.  It was so clean, quick, friendly and some of the best Thai food I've ever had!! 

We stopped in at 8:15pm and we're finished within an hour, including getting 2 apps.  Our waiter was so accommodating and nice.  

I ordered the drunken noodles, seriously the best!  Such good flavor!  I was with 3 other people and between the 4 of us we tried pad Thai, pad see ew, walnut fried rice, crab rangoons, drunken noodles and shrimp chicken dumplings.  Everything we had was phenomenal! 

This is my 7th time in Vegas but my first time here.  I expect to make this a regular stop!

So I came here twice. Not that i had a first bad experience, i just didn't think I'd be back again but when youre staying at ballys, and you're craving noodles, and you're too lazy to leave the hotel, and the Chinese panda express-esque place in the food court is being rude and ignoring you.. I guess you'd somehow find yourself stumbling to the same Thai restaurant again.

So the interior and decor is absolutely beautiful!! My boyfriend and I sat by the water pond thing which felt very intimate and romantic. Kudos on the interior design. We ended up having a lovely dinner that I can only partially remember because let's be honest.. I'm in Vegas. 

We had the mediocre-tasting pad Thai that cost $18. If this wasn't Vegas I'd be outraged cause who would really want to pay double the price for half the portion you can normally get at a Thai restaurant? But, like I said, it's Vegas and the interior was beautiful. 

We also had some fried shrimp and chicken balls as appetizers for $8? It comes with 6 pcs with a yummy dipping sauce. I enjoyed it better than the overpriced pad Thai so I ordered it again the 2nd time I came here. Definitely worth it!
This was the most amazing thai food.. a must visit when you come here.. transports you to Thailand !!! A must on your bucket list for some good food in Vegas

Poor service and mediocre food. 
Due to food allergies and lactose intolerance we had a pretty specific order, and unfortunately our waitress didn't follow through with any of our requests. The pad thai arrived first, covered with peanuts, so that had to be taken back right away since my guest preferred not to make a trip to the hospital. Then the tom yum soup arrived, and surprise, surprise, they still added milk! Luckily my guests had some lactaid pills with them, so they popped those instead of waiting for a new order. This restaurant also charges you for rice- we ordered a large, the waitress brought out a small. We also got pho tai and garlic chicken, but like the other 2 dishes, they were nothing special. Needless to say, I won't be returning.

Good Thai food for the price. The place is gorgeous. Staff was super friendly. 

The only thing I didn't like was the water. It smelled and tasted like a swimming pool. Make sure you ask for bottled water.

I had a taste for thai food and was looking for a close place to the Bellagio hotel. I found this on yelp and was listed as $$ for food which is un true. I had the coconut crusted shrimp for appetizer and that was excellent. Price $13 a little high in my opinion. Then I wanted to eat Tum yum soup and still quite expensive as a bowl is $14, but I had a taste for it and when it came as I ordered it mild, it was Blane. Every thai restaurant I go to when ordering mild it should have some kick, but it did not. Broth was cloudy and had to pick out some inedible stuff in the soup that felt like plastic, but was probably lemon grass or something else. I would think if u are eating a dish that you don't have to fight it to eat it. My main dish was Massaman Curry, which I though was yellow curry, but I think it is peanut based. In any case very blan taste and not spicy at all when ordered mild. When I ordered that they ask you if you want rice and that's another price add on for $3.00 for a small bowl of rice. For crying out loud all thai restaurant will give you a bowl of rice with the order. Pepsi was $4.00 and they didn't have thai ice tea on the menu as I asked if they have that, and they said yea. However, didn't think about asking price as Thai ice tea is usually $3.00and they charges $5.00. Next be aware they automatically add gratuity of 18% on my bill called "party gratuity as I was only one person! All in all I spent $78.18 for a dinner that was not worth the price. Fair warning to all to avoid this place as they Nickle and dime you and food is not that great. It got great ratings on yelp, but wonder if there are so many tourists that don't know what good Thai food taste like. As I am from Chicago and travel quite a bit to experience many Thai restaurants. Hope this helps other to decide if they want to choose this restaurant, as I will not on my next visit.

Great little restaurant tucked away behind the scenes.  The space is on the smaller side for Vegas, which made it nice & quiet.  A little oasis from the lights & noise.  The food was amazing Thai food!  We were able to order & make changes as needed to accommodate my Gluten-Free friends!

Food was fantastic, atmosphere was perfect. Didn't have reservations and still got to sit at the signature "floating" table! Would recommend if you are looking for something on the strip without the strip feel.
The best Thai food in Las Vegas! I was in Vegas for a week and came to this restaurant three times. The pad Thai is amazing! This dish was full of flavor. I definitely recommend this restaurant!!
My favorite restaurant in Ballys. Been waiting to come back here since my last trip to Vegas. The dumplings and pineapple fried rice are the best.

Made reservations, made us wait. Ordered 3 dishes, only got 2. Canceled the 3rd. Asked for a glass with our beer, had to ask for it again 15 minutes later. Never refilled water or soft drink. Never came to check on us at all. Had to flag someone down for everything. When we got the bill, there was a party tip included.  We were a party of 2. Really?!? Food was okay, tasted better. Service needs to improve. Probably won't return.
The Pad Thai is delicious!  Friendly and fast service. The restaurant is clean and beautiful.  You will not be disappointed!

I loved the ambiance!! It's a LOT smaller than the SEA in Brooklyn but same theme. Really cute place for date night. Don't let the fact that's in Bally's steer you away!!! It's a classy/trendy little spot. Food was really good. The reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 is the fact that I got extremely sick immediately after leaving there. Even though that happened, I would still go back and give it another shot. I really enjoyed the food/experience.

First thing First... This restaurant will charge you for booking a reservation through any reservation system, Especially not Open Table unless you are ok with being charged after your meal (they don't tell you upfront). It is listed on your dinner receipt, very shady and deceptive.  While the charge is only $1.00 it is really the of it. 

I would no recommend purchasing their Groupon they treat you as if will be "cheap" even though you really end spending almost the same about if you did. Or purchase it. In total with our Groupon purchase we saved $8.00

Not let's talk about the food, portions are the smaller side for a Thai restaurant but was perfectly fine for us.
Appetizers: Tom Yum soup was good, Steamed Dumpling App was good. 
Entrees:  Green Stir Fry lacked all flavor, Drunken Noodles were decent but nothing to write home about.
Drinks:$4.00 for a hot tea WOW.. at least it should have been a good loose tea blend then not a tea bag!!! Talk about raping your customers! 
I won't begin to tell you what the food did to my wife and I...

The servers were nice, service was quick. The place is cute, we were seated next to a room they put a large party into, our server left to take care of that party and we ended up with a new server. She was nice although did not speak English as well. Personally I think I can think of better Thai restaurants to go to.

May your experience be better than ours.

Awesome food and atmosphere.. Great customer service. I wish i could of stood in the water and took a photo with the buddha statue.. The 3 appetizer was great with satay chicken and thai peanut sauce, dumplings, and duck!!!!

Nice classy and modern decors. Romantic with the dim lighting. Great and fast service. We came here to eat twice in one week during our stay here at Bally's.
 
The food we had did not wow me. I heard the Tom Yum soup was good, but I didn't get to try. The Pad Thai was ok. The beef Pho was way too salty and sweet. Big portion, but expensive ($17). 

I don't think they gave me any bean sprouts and lime the first time I ordered the pho, but the second time they did. 

I would come here for the ambiance, but as for the food I might have to order something else to try again.

SEA had a fun ambience. They had a beautiful fountain with a statue and had an area where the wall changes colors. It had a modern touch to the restaurant. They had EDM going on and the music was fairly loud

Honey walnut shrimp - yummy clean taste

18$ Pad Thai: Could've had better. It was pretty bland. Not good or bad. 

26$ Crab Fried Rice: This was really good. I love crab fried rice and this would be the reason why I would come back, along with the honey walnut shrimp.
